reviewText:
This game is extremely fun and addicting. This is a small mix of League of Legends + Minecraft + TF2, with it's own unique mechanics. There is a small bit of a learning curve, but you can learn it very fast.

Pros
-Fun and addicting
-Not pay2win
You pay for skins, you can pay for heroes, but still get them for free. Perks are also buyable, but only with the free currency.
-A ton of maps
Of course, some are better than others.
-Each game is different
You build and fortify your base, so each game will be different.
-Not region locked
If your friend is from EU and you're from NA you guys can still queue together, unlike a fair amount of games.


Cons
-High queue times
During weekends and afternoon weekdays the queue times are short. But other than that they can be a bit long, and you will run into the same people a lot. They are also a lot longer for players just starting out so you don't run into people who stomp you.
-Unbalanced
The game is a bit unbalanced for sure.
-Ranks
Your rank can only go up, not down. This removes the stress from the game, but rank is less skill and more grind. They are fixing this soon (maybe) with a new ranked mode.

Overall, I for sure recommend this game. It is a ton of fun

reviewText: Block N Load is a great game which encourages emergent gameplay. The game is very fun whilst playing solo but playing with friends the game shines even brighter. The possibilites are literally endless - I have well over 1,000 hours and I still see something new every day I play. strategies evolve over time, and fun hits you in the face from around every corner. I by no means exaggerate at all when I say that playing Block N load has given me the most fun any game has done for a VERY long time. :)

reviewText: Is this supposed to be a logical development from Ace of Spades? Really just feels like a step back. The controls are clunky and unintuitive. AoS was an incredibly fun game before Jagex got their hands on it. This game feels like them trying to brush the AoS name under the rug while releasing an update for that game as a standalone product. Regardless, you know that Jagex rarely listens to players... Any game you purchase from them is a risk that it could change fundamentally overnight.\n\nAnyway, I didn't find this game fun. It's a really nice idea, but the best iteration of this type of game has already been made, which was AoS pre-Jagex.

voteText: 7 of 9 people (78%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
This game is extremely fun and addicting. This is a small mix of League of Legends + Minecraft + TF2, with it's own unique mechanics. There is a small bit of a learning curve, but you can learn it very fast.

Pros
-Fun and addicting
-Not pay2win
You pay for skins, you can pay for heroes, but still get them for free. Perks are also buyable, but only with the free currency.
-A ton of maps
Of course, some are better than others.
-Each game is different
You build and fortify your base, so each game will be different.
-Not region locked
If your friend is from EU and you're from NA you guys can still queue together, unlike a fair amount of games.


Cons
-High queue times
During weekends and afternoon weekdays the queue times are short. But other than that they can be a bit long, and you will run into the same people a lot. They are also a lot longer for players just starting out so you don't run into people who stomp you.
-Unbalanced
The game is a bit unbalanced for sure.
-Ranks
Your rank can only go up, not down. This removes the stress from the game, but rank is less skill and more grind. They are fixing this soon (maybe) with a new ranked mode.

Overall, I for sure recommend this game. It is a ton of fun

reviewText:
If you have played ace of spades or other similar games that introduces voxel base building and first person shooter but was disappointed, then you might avoid it with this game, Block N Load. BnL is trying to have a fine balance between letting a player enjoy base building such as placing blocks, traps, turrets and other gadgets around within a certain time limit, before all hell breaks loose and the big wall is removed. At the same time it is allowing first person shooter fans to have fun just shooting anything and everything, blocks, traps, turrets, players and so on.

Whether you want to focus on building defense, traps and buildings using blocks then you can contribute that way. If you want to go in gunning, then you can do that. If you want to stay behind and snipe, you can do that too. Maybe you want to sneak around and climb up the walls, you can do that too. Perhaps you want to mix it all up, you can do that too.

All in all, it offers a great variety and strategy when playing. If you don't care much for team play you can still have fun just playing lone wolf, gathering resources by breaking bricks and using them to put out lots of firepower in turrets or just traps, even intel such as radar.

If you are terrible at FPS but always wanted to have fun playing an FPS this is your chance to still be a team player, contribute and even end up first in your team...even if you lost the match. As you rack up points also by destroying bricks and placements while building new things. So killing alone might not be sufficient anymore.

So if you enjoy building, placing out things, sneaking, sniping, gunning, running, climbing, jumping, digging, healing, being random, trying to be creative or figure out new ways to combine the different classes you all play as a team who have access to different equipment, to create a new way to attack, defend or just be crazy creative while bombs and gunshot is flying around...then so be it. Do that...

It's a great game. Play it...

Classes - Standard equipment + unique equipment for the class you choose. Level them up, get bonus and more powerful buffs...

Come on, go on....I know you want to play it...

reviewText:
It's great. You should buy it if you enjoy:

- a tactical shooter in which mindless run&gun is punished by an increasing respawn timer and various devious traps that the enemy team builds

- coordinating with friends to pull off crazy stunts

- shooters where you don't die instantly but instead have the ability to balance for screw-ups by tactics and coordination

You shouldn't buy it if:

- You like to run and gun and think that teamwork is for sissies

- You feel like a 40 second respawn timer after 40 minutes of match is too long (the respawn gets longer the longer the game goes on. To prevent eternal games)

- You value solo-play. The game is best when you work together with your team mates. This goes all the way down to your character class selection. The team can't be all Ninjas, so you should be prepared to pick something useful instead.

In general this game is great fun. The graphics are vibrant, the gameplay is very polished and overall balanced. The game rewards playing smart and punishes mindless stupidity. It is prone to griefing and the team suffering due to incompetent members, but as of right now I played 13 hours and have not encountered more than one or two such unfortunate events.

reviewText:
This is my 1st review of any game i have ever put up on steam but i feel compelled to give a review here.



I got this game from a friend and i loved it ever since. Its a moba type game like smite and league but more like smite with it being 3D, it has some building elements inspired from minecraft and fast paced fps action. Defend your base with 4 other people in a 5v5 match. I'v had tons of fun playing this game and i only been playing one class.


Pros:  Fast paced action
Solid game mechanics(Except for the accidental jumping off ledges and the side of the map dying.)
Class's are unique no 2 class feel the same.
Maps are beautiful and colorful
The class level system is really cool and fun gives you mastery over a certain class.
Team based game.

Cons:  Solid game mechanics(Except for the accidental jumping off ledges and the side of the map dying.)
Some class feel over power and very stale to play vs.(Example is Eliza has DoT AoE that does not require much aim             at all.)
The game client could be better
There is only 6 class.s I want there to be more class's.
People can pick the same character in the same game so we basicly could have 10 ninja's all in one game. I dont like this very much because its stale and not very fun i like diversity.
Probably will get boring without more content.




Over all i like this game very very much. I would love for a mod or another version of this game came out like a MMORPG with the class's they have and the skill mechanics. But thats just my idea.

Do i recommend this game. Well lets see i'm going to go out and buy the $20 bundle and get 2 keys so i can play with more friends. I hope you guys like this as much as i do.

reviewText:
This game really does feel like a cross between Team Fortress 2 and Minecraft. It has the best of both worlds: class-based FPS action, destructible/buildable environments, great physics, and a strong tactical feel.

The whole game feels very polished, and at no point did I feel it was pay-to-win. All of the cash shop stuff is cosmetic only, which at this point in the games industry's development, I'm totally OK with.

Well worth the money I spent. Great fun at a cheap price, and it's got loads of replayability.

The only thing I don't like is that some elements of the UI are less polished, like voicechat. Voicechat works well, but it's not well documented and it's hard to tell who's speaking at any given time.

reviewText:
Block N Load is a fun game made by Jagex. In this game, your objective is to destroy the enemy cube(s) while defending your own. You do this by destroying blocks to gain more resources and using those resources to build things.

POSITIVES
No game is the same. This is because you can destroy any block on the map so they're always multiple ways to do things.
The characters are fairly balanced. Some characters are stronger than others however, if played correctly weaker characters can be very strong.
The maps are very good. Each map feels different and unique.
They're not very many hackers/cheaters. I have never encountered one, however they do exist.
The devs interact with the community. Every Monday and Thursday, they livestream (twitch.tv/blocknload) games that you can join.
NEUTRAL
They are 13 characters you can choose to play. This provides variation as each character is unqie and well designed, however  a few more characters to choose from wouldn't hurt.
With any online game, the community is a massive part. The community in BnL varies, from complete idiots to very nice and helpful people.
The tutorial isn't very good. It kind of helps, however it could be improved a lot.
NEGATIVE
The devs don't know how to balance the game and it takes them weeks to fix their mistakes.
They is no casual mode, only a game mode to do with ranks. This can be frustrating for players who just want to be casual.
It's hard for new players to get into. This is because most of the players are experinced and new players get destroyed.
The game is F2P so you might as well try it out. It's very fun and the devs have spent a lot of time making sure that it isn't P2W. I love this game, maybe you will too.

reviewText: I joined the beta of this game a few days ago and I really enjoy the concept and how it changes the normal gameplay of a multiplayer fps by adding in building/destruction elements, but a $30 price tag? I would pay $5 and feel okay about it, or maybe even $10, but not $20-$30. reviewText:
Note: Beta key user from website, then bought full game.

To get your free beta key visit: [https://www.blocknload.com/signup/]

This game is NOT a pay to win (so far) the only thing paying money gets you is skins. There is a forum on steam by the VP / Studio Head going over some of these concerns: [http://steamcommunity.com/app/299360/discussions/0/626329820802521208/]

Buying the full game after owning the beta key will presents you with some orange warning text when purchasing, ignore this, this is because the version of the game you recieve from paying is the same as the beta key version:
[https://steamcommunity.com/app/299360/discussions/0/626329820654746292/?l=finnish]   (scroll down a bit)

Overall i highly recomend this game, it is similiar to the combat and overall design and feel of TF2 with its class based multiplayer and team play aspects. i have seen many people complain about greifers and trolls but i have yet to encounter anyone ingame who has purpousley gone out of their way to achieve this. Really love this game as it combines aspects of minecraft, TF2 and isnt just a 'brute force' game where you can just rush the enemy team; class balancing is generally good but it really depends upon team composition and experience with that class.

And for the low low price of £15 you get the full game on release, a skin pack and woah....A FREE ACE OF SPADES BATTLE BUILDER....*just ♥♥♥♥emed*

TL;DR Great game, shows promise, not p2w, unnecessary Jagex hate, overall 8/10 with potential.

reviewText:
Refreshing gameAfter playing this game for hours, testing everything and being on the multiples forums (steam, reddit) I believe I can make a comprehensive review of this awesome game.
There's a DEMO available, that allow you to play ONLY a few characters available. You can play with every other users, on every maps. Try it before you buy it ! ;) Also a pack (5 players) is available if you have any friends that are willing to play with you.

Pros (+)
Incredible freedom with blocks, it feels good to model the battlefield ! You can dig holes to make traps, create bridge, sneak around below thanks to tunnels, create bunkers. This is great to use your creativity to defend and attack !
The devs are quite present (especially on reddit), and listen to the complaints as well as the questions of the player. (You can find a discussion I had with them on reddit, search for ArthurCP). This feels great to be able to contact people from within !
The characters available are quite different and each bring something powerful and different with them ! From the turret makers to the very mobile ninja, and also a robot making mortars. You're sure to find a character suited to you !
Devs plan to add more characters, more blocks for MORE FUN!  Cons (-)

Lack of players sometimes but not a big issue in my opinion, didn't really felt the lack of players. You might have to wait a few minutes to get into a game. Jagex (the company that own the game) is making a lot of marketing to help onto that.
Jagex do not have a great reputation in the gaming world as they ♥♥♥♥ed up some games. But seems like Block N Load is a completely different story (AT THE MOMENT, 26/06/2015).
Some issues with the matchmaking, that allow team of multiple experimented players against casual/new players. This lead to a very bad first view of the game for the new players.
Even if there's negative points, I highly recommend this game as it's skill rewarding (creativity, time to learn some construction" such as bunkers
date: etc.) and I find the atmosphere really enjoyable !\n\n"
hoursPlayed: true
helpfulPercent: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
9/10
A really fun game. I honestly cannot remember the last time I had so much fun playing a shooter.

Graphics:
The graphics look much more like TF2 than Minecraft, but are unique to themselves. Though there are blocks, many of them are not cubes. There are all shapes and sizes.  It looks sleek and modern, not retro at all. There are also nice shadow and lighting effects. The style works for the type of game it is. In the heat of battles, blocks fly everywhere from explosions going off all around you, which adds to the experience drasticly.

Gameplay:
First and foremost is the unique ability to break or build anything. It adds a layer of strategy not found in most shooters. Defenses do not have to be complicated to be effective, though complicated desings can work if applied correctly. It takes a lot of time to develop good strategies for building on each map.
Once the match begins, after the build stage, you can do just about anything. Digging under a base is as viable as building over one. As others have said, unlike in Minecraft, there is gravity, so you will not be able to build floating bridges.
Each character feels really unique, and you really need one from each of the 3 categories to be successful (usually).  The weapons in this game are SOOO satisfying. A combination of good sound effects and visual effects makes each one pop, and landing a shot, no matter the weapon, always feels good. Each character also has a special ability, which, for most characters, offers support for yourself and all surrounding teamates.
Teamwork is key in this game. You need to use text or voice chat to tell eachother what you are doing, and make sure to plan attacks ahead of time. Running in wildly is not an option in this game, even for the tank class Cog.

Right now there is only one gamemode: Destroy the Base, but the developers are going to have more ready for launch in less than a month. I am hoping for a Payload type mode, where players place the tracks for the bomb train to follow.

Despite just one gamemode, I have yet to become bored, thanks to well designed maps that offer good variety. Player map creation is another planned feature to be looking forward to.

Overall I would HIGHLY recommend this game. It has something for everybody, even those who don't usually like shooters. I hope that this game will continue to expand and grow a healthy community once it is released in a few weeks!
voteText: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Block N Load is a game for itself. Amazing combat, beautiful and well-made maps, funny gameplay and TONS! of gameplay value.

I haven't played this game so much yet, but I've already noticed the small events they have put into the game. Shows that they really put effort into their game.
Around Christmas, they had an event where you had to play 20 matches, to get a Tony skin (Tony is one of the playable characters).

I love the quick combat and the variable combat in this game. Want a new way to go? Dig down and dig away! Dig your way to victory!"

Rate? 8/10. I would like to see more small maps
date: rather than big maps. I enjoyed the 1 core map more than the 3 core maps."

reviewText: I tried this game only because of the free weekend offered on Steam.  Its a Minecraft-ish, tower defence/attack, team FPS.  After playing a few games I discovered I really liked it so dished out the cash and bought it.  At the start of a game each team is closed off to prepare their defence of the cubes.  This involves building/destroying walls, setting traps and adding defences.  Once the curtain" drops the game starts in earnest and you will have to defend the cube against the other team as well attack their cube.  You can do this by running in gung-ho
date: sneaking around the defences or tunnelling in from below.  Sometimes you get stuffed with a rubbish team and you are doomed from the start but to be honest I still enjoy the gameplay.  There is a variety of pre-set characters who are cartoonlike (in fact very Borderlands) but very well drawn with amusing one liners (which do start to get annoying and can give away your position).  So yes I will give this a positive review just because I have had my £10 worth out of the game.  There are more updates coming as well as a new character.\n\ni really really like this game
recommended: HOWEVER the queue times are not acceptable.  So I have changed this review.  I quite regularly queue for 5 or so minutes
hoursPlayed: finally get in a game and then the 10th person doesnt accept.  You then find yourself at the start of another queue starting at zero.  Also if you do get in a game
voteText: you may play a game where one cube is destroyed and you get an ♥♥♥♥ in your team who just wants to give up so continually spams Surrender.  If you fail to agree
helpfulPercent: he/she will then just type abuse and then eventually when you refuse to give up will then attack you and your defence and assist the enemy team.  Then to make it worse at the end of the match they vote you as a bad player just because you want to play the game.  It quite often takes 10 minutes to get in a game so I never want to surrender no matter how bad my team.  The down vote by the "♥♥♥♥" player then affects your queue times negatively.  It is such a shame that the queues are so bad and the fact that the kids get to vote against your willingness to play when it looks like you are losing.  Therefore I cant recommend it any longer.  A great game but ruined by really long queue times."

I love the quick combat and the variable combat in this game. Want a new way to go? Dig down and dig away! Dig your way to victory!"

Rate? 8/10. I would like to see more small maps
date: rather than big maps. I enjoyed the 1 core map more than the 3 core maps."

reviewText:
Refreshing gameAfter playing this game for hours, testing everything and being on the multiples forums (steam, reddit) I believe I can make a comprehensive review of this awesome game.
There's a DEMO available, that allow you to play ONLY a few characters available. You can play with every other users, on every maps. Try it before you buy it ! ;) Also a pack (5 players) is available if you have any friends that are willing to play with you.

Pros (+)
Incredible freedom with blocks, it feels good to model the battlefield ! You can dig holes to make traps, create bridge, sneak around below thanks to tunnels, create bunkers. This is great to use your creativity to defend and attack !
The devs are quite present (especially on reddit), and listen to the complaints as well as the questions of the player. (You can find a discussion I had with them on reddit, search for ArthurCP). This feels great to be able to contact people from within !
The characters available are quite different and each bring something powerful and different with them ! From the turret makers to the very mobile ninja, and also a robot making mortars. You're sure to find a character suited to you !
Devs plan to add more characters, more blocks for MORE FUN!  Cons (-)

Lack of players sometimes but not a big issue in my opinion, didn't really felt the lack of players. You might have to wait a few minutes to get into a game. Jagex (the company that own the game) is making a lot of marketing to help onto that.
Jagex do not have a great reputation in the gaming world as they ♥♥♥♥ed up some games. But seems like Block N Load is a completely different story (AT THE MOMENT, 26/06/2015).
Some issues with the matchmaking, that allow team of multiple experimented players against casual/new players. This lead to a very bad first view of the game for the new players.
Even if there's negative points, I highly recommend this game as it's skill rewarding (creativity, time to learn some construction" such as bunkers
date: etc.) and I find the atmosphere really enjoyable !\n\n"

reviewText:
THIS GAME IS NOT ACE OF SPADES!

People have been  mad at jagex for the things they have done in the past, such as ace of spades, but Block n Load isnt that. Unlike ace of spades, which felt like a crash grab, this game feels like they put their hearts into it, its oozing with character, everything is so colourful and bright. Each class has their own purpose with diffrent blocks and abilities and stats, the classes are also brilliantly desighned, theres ninjas, robots, rambos, crazy scientists, and a sterotype italian. They all have skins which are quite wacky and make you stand out. They are all wellbalanced (maybe the ninja is a bit strong.)

The game play is like a mix of Awesomenauts(A MOBA) and Minecraft,(First person builder) The objective is to destroy the enemies core, and defend yours, you have to build defenses, plant traps and modify the terrrarain so you get full advantage of it, you have to communicate though with whose defending and attacking or it will be a short round.

Only problems ive had with this game is the friendly fire and the trolls, if you have a jerk team mate he can plant tnt onto your core and ruin everyonelses day, if you dont defuse it in time, Theres no punishment for being afk aswell, and its hard finding an oceanic server, luckily N American servers work fine.
voteText: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText: As you may be able to tell by my game time, I have played a fair few games since the beta was released and I was also lucky enough to be able to take part in the Alpha segment of this games. Which is why I can tell you that this game is an extremely fun to play, yet is competitive enough to keep that level of enjoyment at a consistant rate. Would recommend this game to anyone/everyone who's looking for a new game to play with their friends.

reviewText:
I would like to say that this game is extremely fun, but I dunno if I should say if it is STILL fun.
I liked it when lava and water can get you killed, so now if ur on a water map, you literally have to worry about people getting in from the side of the maps or such.
And not only that, but the range of the rocket is outragously long, where the player could literally just place down a ammo block and constantly shoot until the cube explodes.
Another thing that seemed to change is that the ninja is somehow more irritating, I was fine with the ninja disappearing and leaving a bomb, but also healing and replenishing ammo??? It is bad enough if you don't have radars surrounding practically your entire base or the ninja could hide the shrine ANYWHERE. I know the shrine is the ninja's major ability but add that in with the exploding healing smoke bomb....kinda turns the ninja a bit OP
Medic seems good, xcept it isn't fun that she has quite a long range with her gernades.
Science actually seems fine.
Asterella seems fine also.
Sarge is good.
Tony is good.
Nigel is good also (thank god there isn't a scope lol)
Cog is also good.
So far this game was extremely fun when it did the free weekend before it offically got a price. But it somehow seemed to patch a bit and might of accidently made a character or 2 a bit OP without realizing it.

reviewText: This game is pure and simple FUN. It doesn't matter if you're 40 or 10, playing alone or in a full party. Everytime I play a match I have fun, yes I do rage sometimes, but the majority is my own fault :P If you haven't bought it yet but are planning to do it, go ahead, you will only be rewarded (experience, limited offer DLC/skins etc). If you're worried about getting owned, thats not an issue. Play it for 1-2 weeks and you'll get the hang of it. Every character has ups and downs, which makes it easier for you to pick a character without hesitating whether or not you will win gunfights since you don't have to pick the best" one. All around fun game and I highly recommend buying it
recommended: watch some youtube videos. Those will definitely make it clearer for you."

reviewText:
The reason I don't recommend the the game is because of the resent update. Making it Free to play has made it so to have all of the characters, you have to pay. As it is a f2p game, this is expected. When I saw this, i thought it would be fun. I was kinda wrong. Sure it is still the same game, with the none paid for characters still being there, but it is stuff like perks. Before, everyone was on the same level (except those who had put more time into it) so nobody got extras. As of now, you can have such of a bigger advantage.

Also, people who put hours into it before, have nothing. One day I look, level 10 characters. Now, everything is level 0.
:(

reviewText:
I would not recommend it now cause of a lack of server. ( SEA server )

Build defenses make turrets to protect your base from enemies, Easy right? No. There are players that straight up dig from their base to your base making your turrets somewhat useless. But there are players that still go the extra mile to walk the surface of the map, facing your defenses head on to get to your base like a real man, unlike the others that just dig from base to base.

I'd give it a 8/10 IF it had a SEA server.

However it doesnt have a SEA server only US, EU and OCE. So.... Im playing every match with 200 ping constantly. 4/10

reviewText:
Block N Load is something new and fresh to the game market. With it's catchy music, unique art style and competitive multiplayer, this game brings a lot of fun and friends to your PC. Each character you choose has a totally different fighting style and Silhouette, they each have a role to play on this team based multiplayer. Pick the wrong character setup and you may not do to well so choose wisely.

You are a 5 man team facing another 5 man team with your own side of the map. Once the match begins you have a few minuites to prep your base by setting up traps, reinforcing things or building anything you can think of that may help win the game. During this time you cannot see or go to the other teams base, once the timer hits zero each team is free to attack. You may still build after the timer but you will have non friendlys attacking you at any time. The way to win is to attack they enemies cube, a small square genereator looking cube. Depending on the map chosen in the beginning by voting, you may have up to 3 cubes to destroy.  Once one of the two teams destroys all of the cubes it is game over where you can look at your stats before heading back to start a new mach.

I fell in love with Block N Load. It's refreshing to see something new on the market with a great community including friends from all over the world. Everyone is there to help you because they need you in order to win. The devs are very good at responding to any questions, concearns or just to chat occasionally. I find myself not wanting to stop playing even when I need to. Every game I find myself on the edge of my seat as I get into fast paced battles with other players seeing who can outsmart our destroy the other.  Each play is different and the game can change and flip at any moment, you will find yourself stuck fighting and defending untill one team breaks through enemy lines taking you and your cube down or vise versa. That is what makes me love this game, that is why I reccomend this game. No other game can you laugh, fight, and sometimes cry all in one match.

reviewText:
Played this for a couple hours now and I must say, I've been looking for a game like this.

The game looks very simple but it involves a good amount of skill and teamwork to defeat your opponents.

I think the game also has quite some replay value, since every match you play is different. There's different ways of trying to win a match. Also finding the perfect way to defend your base will probably be a long road.

The private matches are fun party games to do when you're with a bunch of friends and looking for things to play together.

The hero-system reminds me of League of Legends, you can choose from a bunch of heroes that all have different abilities. As far as I assume they will be adding more heroes over time(?)

Overall I think this game is good fun!

reviewText:
Block N' Load was an amazing Beta when I played it. The only problems I had with the game, wasn't really the game itself:
Graphics are good, game-play is one-of-a-kind, and it is truly fun to play.

My issues lied within the community; I adore a good game, but if it's going to be centered around multiplayer, community is important. The Beta had only a few players who were willing to buy it, and the ones who probably got a code generator were hackers, and without any V.A.C. system or report features, this game was horrible to play and have a good time.

Now, fully fledged with constantly updated and bursting new content all the time, the community is much better. I know a lot of people may think that Free-to-Play means lots of noob-ish players, but at least their better than too few players at all, or hackers! And on top of that, anyone who DID buy the Beta, retains some of the previously available (but now unlockables) from the getgo.

As far as game-play goes, everything is pretty balanced an fair to play, it runs smooth, looks nice, controls are a bit clunky (who cares, you can reconfigure them!), but best of all: IT'S A GAME THAT IS A FREE TO PLAY AND DOESN'T FOCUS ON MICRO-TRANSACTIONS! Yeah, they have them, but they really won't get you anything that gives any sort of advantage over another player. Their also not so in-your-face about them either, almost like a thing you can do but you have no reason to do it.

All in all,
8.6/10
-CrazyContraption @ R&S Corp.

reviewText:
Block N' Load was an amazing Beta when I played it. The only problems I had with the game, wasn't really the game itself:
Graphics are good, game-play is one-of-a-kind, and it is truly fun to play.

My issues lied within the community; I adore a good game, but if it's going to be centered around multiplayer, community is important. The Beta had only a few players who were willing to buy it, and the ones who probably got a code generator were hackers, and without any V.A.C. system or report features, this game was horrible to play and have a good time.

Now, fully fledged with constantly updated and bursting new content all the time, the community is much better. I know a lot of people may think that Free-to-Play means lots of noob-ish players, but at least their better than too few players at all, or hackers! And on top of that, anyone who DID buy the Beta, retains some of the previously available (but now unlockables) from the getgo.

As far as game-play goes, everything is pretty balanced an fair to play, it runs smooth, looks nice, controls are a bit clunky (who cares, you can reconfigure them!), but best of all: IT'S A GAME THAT IS A FREE TO PLAY AND DOESN'T FOCUS ON MICRO-TRANSACTIONS! Yeah, they have them, but they really won't get you anything that gives any sort of advantage over another player. Their also not so in-your-face about them either, almost like a thing you can do but you have no reason to do it.

All in all,
8.6/10
-CrazyContraption @ R&S Corp.

So overall its a really well made game but its for the most part made a bad game because of the players.

reviewText:
Amazing game. I have a group of buddies I play this with. At the moment, it's free since it's in beta and you can just sign up, instantly getting a code to play the game. So easily I got my friends involved and we are having a blast. For a blocky game the graphics are quite good, but what really sold this game to me was the character design. Each character is very funny, great dialogue. Robot is the funniest.

Gameplay: Super addicting game, you build, destroy, and work as a team of 5 for an objective. It's an fps where you think hard about how you should build a base/walls/traps/turrets/healing blocks/mines/ ect ect..  depending on your enemy team comp. I have seen many unique strategies, skybridging, speedtunneling(speed boosts and crawling) Lavacore, SpawnWalling, bridge removing. At it goes on and on.

I would like to see more block types and more playable characters. I main the ninja and I think he is OP, but he has a high skill ceiling. I see many other ninjas do poorly. The sniper is currenltly the weakest, He is only good if you play him on wilson bay with a health and ammo crate in the lighthouse, and... spam tiki towers. The ping is a bit off which also makes sniper hard.

Definitely worth a look if you find it on a Steam sale.

reviewText: I did like this game, when it first came out I played it for a while, then some more characters came in and some balancing changes happened that made the game just feel bad and unbalanced. Now it is free to play and my level has reset I find myself in matches with people who know nothing about the game, this basically shows you that the game is reliant on team play (which is good) sadly if you effectively defend but your team for some stupid reason doesn't attack then you can't win. Or if you are good at attacking yet your team suck at defending your cube is destroyed before you manage to destroy theirs.\n\nOverall maybe one day it will be cook but as for now I doubt ill be playing this game again.

reviewText:
Amazing game. I have a group of buddies I play this with. At the moment, it's free since it's in beta and you can just sign up, instantly getting a code to play the game. So easily I got my friends involved and we are having a blast. For a blocky game the graphics are quite good, but what really sold this game to me was the character design. Each character is very funny, great dialogue. Robot is the funniest.

Gameplay: Super addicting game, you build, destroy, and work as a team of 5 for an objective. It's an fps where you think hard about how you should build a base/walls/traps/turrets/healing blocks/mines/ ect ect..  depending on your enemy team comp. I have seen many unique strategies, skybridging, speedtunneling(speed boosts and crawling) Lavacore, SpawnWalling, bridge removing. At it goes on and on.

I would like to see more block types and more playable characters. I main the ninja and I think he is OP, but he has a high skill ceiling. I see many other ninjas do poorly. The sniper is currenltly the weakest, He is only good if you play him on wilson bay with a health and ammo crate in the lighthouse, and... spam tiki towers. The ping is a bit off which also makes sniper hard.

reviewText:
For £10 it's a very top game for it's money, but because it costs £22... well you know too exspensive.

Pro's
-Awesome concept and idea and works very well in practise
-Looks very beatiful
-Block physics are very very cool
-Classes are pretty original by now but there abilites go well witht he classes and are cool ideas and look good
-GUI is actually really decent
-Soundtrack is also very good
-Effects are very artistic and look nice in there cartoon fashion

Cons
-Plays slow and badly paced most of the time
-Movement is really horrible, as said on another review it's like sticky custard. You can jump and feel the momentum but one block will stop that moment making the game feel sluggish and damn bad. (MAJOR FLAW FOR ME)
-Some unbalanced classes (Nail shotgun uselessly weak vs mostly all other hero weapons)
-Map does not get destroyed as much as i'd like.

Good/ish things
-Maps are bland looking but that works well for building on.
-Art style feel everso slightly all over the palce.
(Super cool looking cartoony effects, with a blocky works, and with decently high detailed characters feels like an odd mix of content)

I recomend for £10-£15 not any higher i'm sorry even with all the pro's it just feels slow and slugish.
voteText: 4 of 6 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Edit: Oh bummer, seems the beta key I got that gave me access to the beta for free is no longer valid, looks like I have to shell 15 dollars out to keep playing. Perhaps I can argue that I bought Ace of spades and deserve to get this for free? D:

Just so you guys know, I was one of the people who was horribly let down by Jagex's fantastic butchering of Ace Of Spades which left me unsatisfied and . So When I first heard of this game, I was FURIOUS. How dare Jagex make another game using the same font layout for the title using the same concept?

So I started playing it recently, and I'm amazed with how far they've come and how much they've improved. With no dedicated fanbase of origin like Ace Of Spades, they took some neat creative freedom, making a MOBA-styled shooter with building integrated into the gameplay. Gameplay can have a lot of variety, as one can shift between offense and defense pretty quickly! using the same character! Destructive items are limited by the fact that they cost a lot of blocks" to build and take awhile to do so
date: discouraging griefers from just spamming bombs as they would have to gather the resources  to break blocks by digging a ton first.\n\nOnly nitpick I have right now is the time it takes to find a match
recommended: but that's presumably due to the game being in beta and weekend-long windows that the devs have been leaving for public testing. It's also a bit difficult to use the weapons in combat as there are no bots one can train against to help track moving targets
hoursPlayed: so it's reccomended you bring your 1337 tracking skillz to this game from other games.\n\nOverall
voteText: a very enjoyable and chaotic game!"

reviewText:
As far as block based shooters go, Block N Load is the best in my opinion.

Me and my friends are having a great time with this game. We experiment with new tactics and defenses. We co-operate and talk with each other more often than in any other game. Each victory we get together as a team, makes us more invested than before.

I can understand why other people might not like this game. The gunplay is competent, but it is difficult to switch between weapons quickly. Charecters have a small amount of lines they spew out all the time, but at least they say somewhat humorous stuff.

My only real complaint is that keybinding isn't compatible with all keys on the keyboard. For instance, I can't bind crouch to shift.

All in all, I think Block N Load is a fun shooter, and is worthy of your time and money.

Don't forget...

Building is awesome.

reviewText: If you're thinking about buying the pre-release, I highly recommend it. Not only do you get the game but some AMAZING skins and ace of spades. Jagex may have made some mistakes in the past but they're really bringing it back with BnL. This game gets tweaked  and updated so often and they are always adding new things, like how  recently they added 3 new characters. Also, there are loads of things to come such as new maps, characters, and even gamemodes!\n\nWhat I like about BnL is that you can play really casually or you can go hardcore if you want. Also, it's not violent compared to other FPS' and has a lot of variety. Like their motto says, no game is the same, and this  is completely true. BnL is a like a mix of TF2  and minecraft. What more could you  want  from a game?

Overall i would rate this game 7/10 and its great entertainment for great value.

reviewText: This game is absolutely fantastic. As someone with 1000+ hours in TF2, it feels like a very similar style of shooter. However, this game has an absolutely incredible level of depth and strategy that TF2 lacks. Conversely, however, the point-and-click aiming skill of many shooters is less prevalent in this game, though still very much present. All around, it is a fantastic game by one of my favorite developers, and it is well worth the price.

reviewText:
9/10
The game is what is says... a unique fps
but first off... this is not minecraft...
while it might look simular, you can only place 7 blocks (6 that you can choose, and 1 based on the class you chose out of 5 classes), and their main purpose is movement, attacking, or defending. you are not building just for the sake of it...
if you whant to compare it to a game, you would have to choose tf2 (with simular class, gameplay and weapons system), or battlefield 4 (with is's destructable enviroment).
while it is a little repeditive, the game requires teamwork and strategy that makes it compelling to win.
there is a little lag at times, but it is currentley still in beta so this is expected.
~ajcres

reviewText:
Quite a well thought out game! With hardly any bugs (the only bugs being very minor), this game definetly gets a 10/10 from me!

The game is amazingly stable! On my stock laptop that I use for video/image editing and such, I can get a solid 30fps on maximum graphics!

The gameplay is to be reckoned with as every game is unique and fun in its own way, and it can be fun for either team wether they are playing offence or defence!

With a couple of new Heroes, maps and blocks, this game could reach the top of my favourite game list! (Yes I actually have a notepad file with a list on it 0.o)

TL;DR... Great game, now get in the fight Blockheads!

voteText: 14 of 26 people (54%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Now, I wasn't expecting much from this game. Another competitive block-building fps, we have hundreds of those on the market as it is. What really made me doubtful was that this game is being developed by Jagex, the very same Jagex that took Ace of Spades and made it an abomination. However, Block N Load surprised me. It takes all the good parts of all those cube-based fps and mashes them all together a giant... Well... Block!

If you have ever played Team Fortress 2, you may notice that this game is VERY simialar to the Fort Wars gamemode. It pits two teams of five on either side of a giant wall. You start with a certain amount of block points, and destroy blocks to make more. These teams must hurry to build their defenses with the resources given before the wall goes down. Once the wall is down, each team must fight through the opposing teams defenses to destroy three cubes in order, and they win. Sounds simple, right? Wrong! This game is clever, and allows you to create virtually any devious defense or trap in your base. There are a decent amount of maps atm, and more to come.All of this means that the gameplay is always changing, and you must overcome the obstacles of the enemy team while maintaining your OWN defenses.

The game has a variety of blocks you can create, like the commando's more offensive C4 block, or the scientists defensive miasma mine. Some blocks can be used to chain combos that can do massive damage to your enemy. Me and my friend once placed a bunch of fire traps underneath fake blocks. Right when the enemy walked over my fake blocks, they fell into a fiery death. It is very satisfying to combine your blocks with other players so that combos like these can happen, teamwork like this is a very good thing in Block N Load.

Class balancing IS influenced in Block N Load, which is a huge plus. Each class has their own special block that only he/she can create. For example, the more defensive class, the construction worker, can create turrets. A more offensive class, the ninja, can create a ninja nest to teleport to. This means that each class has their own specific roles, whether it's defensive or offensive. You can't have an entire team of ninjas and expect to defend your base well. On the other hand, you can't have five construction workers and attack very well, either. These are only two classes of six in the game right now, I'm just using them because their good examples.

Not only that, but the game looks surprisingly good under the circumstances. Most block-building fps have dull graphics, and look... Well... Gross. This game has nice looking visuals, great particle effects, and a pretty atmosphere. The models are cartoony, but in a neat way. Block N Load just looks well polished overall.

Their are only a few cons I can think of. As of right now, there's a lack of weapon diversity. Every class has the same loadout everytime. This isn't MUCH of an issue, it's just that it can get boring after a while to be the same class with the same weapons and abilities everytime. There's also only one gamemode, which also isn't too much of a problem for me at least. Yet, I can see the game getting more players if these problems were taken care of, as this one gamemode may not fancy to everyone. It IS in beta, so these problems are prone to change.

Overall, I really enjoy Block N Load. It's a fresh new experience, with fun that will last a long time. If you need a new fps, I recommend giving this one a try.

I'm trying to be as critical as I can.  But this game ROXOZ MY BOXORZ!!!

I haven't found anything ever quite so entertaining.  I love TF2 and I love MineCraft but both can get a little dull. I am hoping the rest of the world sees how cool this game is and comes to play!

reviewText:
Best FPS!!!

About This Game
BETA REGION SERVERS: USA / EUROPE / OCEANIA

Five of you. Five of them. Face off in a tactical battle where everything you build, destroy, construct or shoot has devastating impact on the entire game. Build your defences and charge into action to destroy theirs. Tunnel under the map or catapult over it, they’ll never see it coming! Be sneaky, be devious, be destructive. Be a large metal robot, twisted scientist, deadly ninja and more. Build using a crazy range of block types and work together as a maverick team in this FPS where no game is ever the same. Ready up! It’s time to Block N Load.
Tell Me More!
NO GAME THE SAME: The game world is ever-changing and evolving throughout every match, as players creatively build and tunnel their way to enemy positions and onto victory.
UNHINGED HEROES: Character variety offers a robust mix of roles for full combat, defensive and supportive players in a team.
BRAINS AS IMPORTANT AS BULLETS: Every game has a blend of intelligent and creative tactics fused with strategic shooter action. It’s fast-paced yet strategic.
BUILD PHASE: Experiment and take the time to work on your defences, traps and setups before the team attacks truly begin.
MASTERS OF CONSTRUCTION: Creative use of a wide choice of blocks in-game mean your deadly and devious constructions can cause havoc with the enemy – and the map.
WHAT THE BLOCK!? Big bombs, turrets, bounce pads, poison traps, landmines, forcefields, speed pads, mortars, glue blocks, health blocks, ammo blocks and more. Everything you need for calculated mayhem.
RANKED PLAY: Play for global accolades within the tiered Ranked Play system. Prove your worth against the rest of the best.
CUSTOM GAME MODE: Set up your own game on the servers to choose your favourite map and build time.

reviewText: This is a very interesting game. It takes MOBA style objectives in order to win, FPS style shooting, Minecraft style building all bundled together into one game. When first entering a game you have 5 mins to build with blocks. The goal of the game is to Protect your cores" while attacking the enemy's. Within these 5 minutes you have to build fortifactions
date: and maybe a setup to build into No man's land. When this time is up the barrier that blocks you disappears and you attack. Every character is uniquely designed weapons wise. The medic has a gun that arcs balls
hoursPlayed: a soldier with a m60
voteText: a hunter with a sniper (scopeless)
helpfulPercent: a ninja with shurikans
votesHelpful: and an engineer with a shotgun. While these characters are interesting I do have to admit certain guns are directly more powerful than others. The sniper rifle can be used in CQB and is generally better than the Medic's "bubble gun". In certain times it can even trump the shotgun that can only be used in close quarters. While the chaingun does do fast damage. With that said maybe these classes aren't right for me since I use cogwheel the robot tank mostly. With all that said
votesTotal:
this game plays well and is a lot of fun.  However I came along with some issues.

Number 1: The game can be VERY slow. As in the two teams just defend and no  one tries to make a move. I've been in many hour + games.

While this is mostly the player's fault
votesFunny: it can be resolved with a timer ticking down or some sort of penalty.\n\nNumber 2: If you get stuck with a new player
commentsCount: you lost.\n\nThe game has a video explaining what to do
column16: and it doesn't explain well. A hands on tutorial would be best to fix this\n\nNumber 3: If one person leaves
column17: you are at a serious disadvantage and have a way greater chance at losing the game.\n\nLike issue number 1
column18: this is more player's error
column19:
but can be fixed with a severe penalty. Leaving a game because you died once is no reason to make your team lose.

Numbner 3.5: There are as many AFKers as people that leave too.

Once again
column20: have a penalty for AFKing
column21: or make it easy to report these players\n\nNumber 4: This game is no way worth the price it's being asked. It's a fun game
column22:
but not a $30 fun game.

Making this free to play with skin sales or making it atleast $15 cheaper would make it worth it. At least what I'm shown isn't worth $30

Currently playing the beta
column23: I'm going to recommend this game as it is tons of fun as a free game and I completely respect that it's a game in beta. However if these issues aren't addressed
column24: I can't recommend it. With all that said the biggest issue is the pricing point + the ingame marketplace where you must pay for skins. With that said

reviewText:
This game is FPS. If you are good at other FPS's, you are still nothing in this game.

[h] What is this about? [/h]

It is about 5vs5 game where you usually want to destroy enemy core cube. There is 3 characters in free rotation, but total of 12 in total to play with in the moment I post this.
You can buy characters with either in-game money, which you get from playing game and once-a-day resetting small achivements, such as kill 3 brawn-class heroes or build 3 dynamite blocks. There is also this better money which you can buy with real money, which can be used also for purchasing heroes. Each class also has skins which you can buy with it, but real money makes you no better player than other.

Each class is different, and by different I mean by A LOT different. Sniper can only fight seriously from range, ninja brutally murders anyone in melee range and engineer keeps itself alive with turrets. So this game has 12 heroes whose all have this much difference. But each class have blocks, the building is important for all classes. For engineer it is the whole life, but ninja needs ninja nests which he can teleport into with his ability and sniper again can build tiki towers which can work as personal defense, or for greater good, for defending the core. Build, Build, Build.

The video in startup of the game tells much. You have to watch it to understand many things in first place, but there is perfect line picked from there:

If you can't get there
date: go over it. If you can't get over
recommended: get under it. "\n\nThis game is about strategy. You have to plan how to defend
hoursPlayed: or you will lose. You will know how to counter a defense to win in first place. You need to know how classes work in order to do anything useful with them or even counter them. Killing only slows enemy team
voteText: but never stops them from acting.\n\nTo this all
helpfulPercent: you need to know how to shoot. It is important
votesHelpful: but it only is only partion of total image.\n\nIn it's finest this game is a strategy game. I would say it to be mix of Minecraft
votesTotal: Team Fortress and League Of The Legends.\n\nTo make FPS gamers sad
votesFunny:
[h]You need to know these to be good[/h]
* how to defend
* how to counter as many different defenses as possible
* teamwork. TEAMWORK.
* knowledge of all special blocks
* know how to use class
* know all the classes by look and voice
commentsCount:
it it important
* know how to counter any class

If this didn't scare you enough
column16: well
column17:
I can't tell how this game works by typing letters here. You must see it.


Not recommended for devoted CoD or CS players. Game is too complex. You need more than gun and reflexes.

Recommended for Minecraft or Tf2 players. Game shares many core ideas like 3D building and required teamwork.

Must-have for ones who would like to see Minecraft
column18: Team Fortress and League Of The Legends together."

reviewText:
I've put more than a little time into this game, and I have to say, the developers listen to the fans. The community routinely bounces ideas off of them, and they very often implement their suggestions. If someone's OP, they fix it.

Additionally, each character has a serious amount of depth to them. Personally it's taken me dozens of games to get competent with a single character, and even then you still learn something new every game. Would definitely reccomend in its current state as a fast tactical shooter best enjoyed with friends.

8.5/10
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
Actualy liked Ace of Spades. Figure I'd give this a try too.


Launch game. Get all set up with character and watch loading video. Hey, looks hopefull!

Click lanch game.

25 mins later it queus me into a group. Ok, new game with small playerbase I figure. Lets see how it plays.

Join ingame, figure out how to procede to gear out my character with zero instructions it gave before hand, not too bad you can figure it out I figure. Players start harrasing other players who couldent figure it out fast enough... Well, there are allways gonna be a**h**** in games, nothing new right?

Finaly get in match. Start building up defences... Fall to my death because teammates are leveling everything.... Well, at least there is block physics right!?

Start building again with bumpers to jump up high. Teammates start placing blocks to block bouncers....  ok..

Start to play game, typical fast paced shooter. Nothing new or out of the norm" of other games. Linear maps that force player interaction which is good.

Team gets rushed with in 2 mins. Surrender on screen and team surrenders. 25+ mins of waiting
date: over in under 8mins (including 5 mins of initial build time).\n\nGet to scoreboard. Figure
hoursPlayed: it was just a bad round
voteText: happens in anygame
helpfulPercent: lets try again!"\nOk
votesHelpful: so how do we get into the next round? Looking... Looking... Looking.... Seeing everyone "discconect" one by one... Realize
votesTotal: you don't get another round! You don't requeue... Only one button
votesFunny: return to menu to start this "fun" series of events over from the begining....\n\nWell
commentsCount: that's enough of that. The way it seems now
column16: this game is not gonna get enough player traction to go anywhere. Then
column17: noticed the price they will try to sell this for... I would have been dissapointed at the $9.99 mark. But $30.00? WOWZA.\n\nGL to this game. In its current state
column18: its gonna need all the luck it can get.\nFinal verdict. Get the beta for free and give it a try as long as you can bear it. Perhaps things will improve as time goes on
column19:
as is the point to Beta's.

If nothing changes... I wouldent even think of spending money on this.


***TAKE 2***

Just be cautious of this when purchasing the game...

EDIT: Game is now FTP. This could fix the lack of games and it's free now so there is no risk trying. Check out the game because it's pretty fun.

reviewText:
I've put more than a little time into this game, and I have to say, the developers listen to the fans. The community routinely bounces ideas off of them, and they very often implement their suggestions. If someone's OP, they fix it.

Additionally, each character has a serious amount of depth to them. Personally it's taken me dozens of games to get competent with a single character, and even then you still learn something new every game. Would definitely reccomend in its current state as a fast tactical shooter best enjoyed with friends.

8.5/10

reviewText:
The devs need to add some new gamemodes,maps,characters and this game will become much more interesting.

Here are some hero ideas:
1.Boom: A suicider.
Primary- A grenade.Its deals really high damage at close range.The only attack for it is to detonate it,in your hand,which kills you in the process.But you can move when detonating it.
Secondary-A pistol would do fine.
Class block-Flash mine.When an enemy enters its radius,it will blind the enemy for a few seconds and stop them from moving.Perfect time for you to suicide.
Active skill-Increases moving speed and grants damage reduction.
Passive skill-Killing an enemy with your primary will revive you on the spot.

2.SH1ELD: A defensive tank( the opposite of cogwheel)
Primary-Shield gun. A gun that lobs mini shields that cover a small radius for a short while.If an ally is in it he will be shielded,if an enemy is inside he will receive damage.
Secondary-Force gun.A gun that can attract or repel enemies.
Class block-Shields(obviously).These shields are one sided and can soak up tons of damage.
Active skill-Grants shields to allies in a certain area that soaks up a certain amount of damage before depleting.
Passive skill-Part of damage taken is turned into health.

Thats all I can think of now.Hope the developers see this!

EDIT:The hamster is a tad bit too OP.Should really nerf it.

reviewText:
This is an absoulutely amazing game and I have locked around 107 hours on this - a must play. It was implemented a while ago that the game was free to play and after that is exploded. Essentially it is a online block based stratergy shooter game, It is a very broad game with about 14 hero`s to play as with different skins and abilities - so one hero will be right for you. You play in multiplayer and there is a chat and voice chat to communicate with fellow teammates and you can also play with steam friends. Overall you defend your base and attack the other team - sounds simple but hours of fun to be had. This is one of the best games ive found in steam that is free to play and several youtuber have played it - boosting its popularity. However theese things may avert you from the game for some people:
-Purchases- You can buy things in game to get new heroes, skins and abilities.
-Cube style graphics- If you dont like this style and flow of a game it may be a deterrant for you.
-Trollers- Really this is anyones nightmare, in this game there are ways to break other peoples hard made defenses and even kill then which is very annoying, however you can report them and the Block N Load team are very supportive and helpful if there is any issues.

Things I like:
-Smooth gameplay- You dont need a high spec computer to play this, a regualr laptop will do fine.
-Child freindly- No graphic voilence, blood or rude language, completely clean.
-Variety- You can play as loads or hero`s and have different upgrades to add you own personal spin and skins to make characters look new. Also lots of maps to play.
-Creators, welcome!- they have recently released a new editor map feature to allow people to customise their own maps and unleash them to the steam workshop for other to enjoy.
-Play with friends- You can play with freinds you have on steam and freinds you have on the game itself. Also you can make a private game so only you and your freinds can join.
-High quality sound effects and graphics- They sound quality is supoerb even on myu laptop speakers and the graphics are near the top for this new cube style.

Overall this is an amazing game and everyone should try it. 10/10 from me.

reviewText:
great game 10/9. but didn't know what to review so instead i made this peanut butter-chocolate cookie recipe.

INGREDIENTS

1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour, (spooned and leveled)
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup peanut butter (smooth or chunky)
4 tablespoons ( 1/2 stick) unsalted butter, room temperature
1/2 cup packed dark-brown sugar
1/2 cup granulated sugar
2 large eggs
1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
8 ounces semisweet chocolate, cut into chunks

DIRECTIONS

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a bowl, whisk together flour and baking soda; set aside. In a large bowl, using an electric mixer, beat peanut butter, butter, and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla, and beat until smooth. With mixer on low, gradually add flour mixture, beating just until combined. Stir in chocolate chunks.

Drop dough by heaping tablespoons, 1 inch apart, onto two large baking sheets. Bake until golden, 13 to 15 minutes, rotating sheets halfway through. Transfer cookies to wire racks to cool.

reviewText: This game was pretty good. I mean the added extra stuff and they were keeping it in a pretty safe place. Now it's F2P and I don't think it's going to last a lot of time. I'm giving this a positive grade since the game was really good before F2P and I would love to see it leave the devastating F2P era. You can see from my hours that I do have some knowledge and I know the game well enough to judge it. No, I'm not buying platinum bars, I'm sorry but I bought the game when it was 13E so no, I'm not willing to give anymore money, instead give me the chars for free. I know that this F2P thing is to attract people but Jagex you already had the demo, wasn't this good enough?\nOverall this game was pretty ok, if they remove the F2P (which is obvi the same thing as the demo for people that didn't buy the game before + they have to spend 10E in order to buy 3 characters and also each one of the new chars costs 8E , *are you out of your mind?*) I think it's going to be more stable since it will attract back older audience. Prepare for trolls and little kids everyone, you've been warned.

reviewText:
This is a quick review, summs up my short playtime of this game, and the things you will see if you start playing.

This is a class based voxel FPS with the building style of minecraft and a similar class system to a mixure of LoL and Team Fortress. Each week, three characters are free to play, and during that period, they cost less. Currently there is around 15 characters.

The gameplay is simple.Two teams of five, drafted with the matchmaking system od LoL.Few minutes when the teams are blocked from each other, this is the time to construct your defenses and set up a special offense strategy(like digging a straight tunnel right under the surface, just to place a respawn pad below the enemies base), then the game starts, time to shoot each other, destroy the enemies defense and base, while defending yours.

You need teamwork, much.Most people of the growing community understand that, but there are some kids raised on CoD and BF, who think their defense is supperior and everyone else just blocks them(some kid actually started remowing my turrets and radars from the places i placed them, just to get angry when i rebuilt them.), or think they will win the match by running and gunning(no, that does not work).

The graphics are good, for the style of the game, but it has pretty big requirements.The sounds are good.

I have only encountered one bug, when i, with the sniper class killed 3 enemies in short range combat with my revolver, because i did'nt take any damage until i was in prone.

You get XP and money VERY slow, which might be annoying to some people.That goes for the game in overall, its kinda slow.

The devs are amazing, they give the players every opportunity to express their thoughts, and they actually listen.

There are some problems, like the game is very much based on offense right now, and there are some very OP ways to win(digging a tunnel, building over the map and stuff like that.

So thats it.A good but still developing game of its kind(compared to many abominations), with a developing community, some bugs, and somewhat high requrements.I would say its worth a shot, its free after all.Beause its still in development, this might change in the future, but right now this game is just amazing.

I give this game 9.5/10. TRY IT! I KNOW YOU WANT TO!!!

reviewText:
9/10
Very great game with great mechanics. Honestly, I find myself playing it more than any other game on my computer and I have at least 50. It doesn't take a high performance computer to play. I play it on my laptop with 40+ FPS.

There are interesting characters and skins. The many blocks, gadgets and defenses are absolutely awesome. There's a very tactical method to the game. If you just go in blindly shooting, you probably won't get far. A lot of the time you have to sacrifice kills for winning.

Over-all, I love this game. A very beautiful blend of FPS and Minecraft (not in a bad way at all.) The only issue is some minor pay-to-win elements but it's nothing to be too concerned about. Just needs some balancing, in my opinion.

reviewText: I was a beta tester for Block N Load, so I've been playing it since the very beggining, and to be honest, there was nothing wrong with the pay-to-play version. It feels like Jagex realy took down the game's quality in an attempt to make this game more widely available. I mean, we used to have all heros and the only problem I can think of is a semi-long que time, not to mention the fact that most people had to pay $30 for this, and are only compensated with a $10 premium package. But with the addition of having to buy heros, perks, and other things, it seems that this once great game is going to freemium purgitory. However, the game is very innovative and fun, especialy if you're a fan of minecraft or TF2. overall, I would give this game a 7.8/10 for the new updates. Please Jagex, if your reading this, make some sort of change for everyone who is very dissapointed, who bought the game and are now disgraced by the fact that they have to share a que with unskilled free-to-play players who only make the game that much more frustrating. I would recomend something like a server for premium members, or even better, a remake of the origional.

It's tons of fun, it's balanced with ONE exception.
Cogwheel, get your ♥♥♥♥ together because you're still gunning me down without issues when we're two against you.

Again, LOADS of fun!

reviewText:
This game. Just playing it for a few hours, and I'm HOOKED!

Characters are an interesting bunch, each of them with their own abilities and special buildings. Also, some voice lines are really funny. Sure, some characters take time to learn, but the game is always about team effort and composition.

The stages are enjoyable, comprising of small ones with 1 cube to big ones with 3. A lot of them also have good spots for hiding e.g. respawn pads in enemy territory

When it comes to matches, they always differ from one another; for example, I could end up with a bad team in one match, losing really badly, and suddenly have a skillful one in another, winning with a big margin.

I'd say, this is one of the most unique FPS games I've seen. And since it also became free-to-play, there really is no restriction on playerbase. Friendly hint: go through the tutorials before playing to get familiar with the mechanics

reviewText: This game was pretty good. I mean the added extra stuff and they were keeping it in a pretty safe place. Now it's F2P and I don't think it's going to last a lot of time. I'm giving this a positive grade since the game was really good before F2P and I would love to see it leave the devastating F2P era. You can see from my hours that I do have some knowledge and I know the game well enough to judge it. No, I'm not buying platinum bars, I'm sorry but I bought the game when it was 13E so no, I'm not willing to give anymore money, instead give me the chars for free. I know that this F2P thing is to attract people but Jagex you already had the demo, wasn't this good enough?\nOverall this game was pretty ok, if they remove the F2P (which is obvi the same thing as the demo for people that didn't buy the game before + they have to spend 10E in order to buy 3 characters and also each one of the new chars costs 8E , *are you out of your mind?*) I think it's going to be more stable since it will attract back older audience. Prepare for trolls and little kids everyone, you've been warned.
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
A decent game combining tf2 and ace of spade, but it falls a bit flat.
1) you have no characters to start off with. You get to use 3 characters for free, in a cycle (think league of legends). This doesn't do anything but make the characters you got good at disapear until they're back in the cycle or you buy them with either a) in game currency htat takes a while to earn or b) your own money. This is stupid. It doesn't add anything to the game and just messes up what could be a fun free-to-play game. I want free to play, not fee to pay.
2) no single player with bots. this means if you have bad internet, don't buy this game.
3) as of this review, there's only one main gamemode - classic, in which you defend your core and attack the other teams core. it need a capture the flag mode or something else to make the game better.
4) respawn times feel a tad to long, with them being between 10-15 secconds usually, it rips you out of the action and makes you just sit there
5) needs better server selection and more server capabilities. look at tf2 with its excess of server type, with different add-ons and plugins that make the game last a lot longer.
6) skins can only be bought with real cash. your money takes ages to get anyways, let me buy a skin for my character


all in all a decent free-to-play game that sadly falls flat 7.5/10, would reconmend but because its for free and has a decent concept behind it

reviewText:
At first I was not very impressed, I felt that the game wasn't optimized enough, it felt laggy and slow.
I was killed by ninjas, mauled by wrestlers, gunned down by robots, watching my enemy, Tony Turreto building gun-towers in our base.

I then upped the graphics, to max.
Then my game went fluid, I got more and more hang of it.
Now I'm glued to this game, almost all my spare time I have, I spend on this game.
It's a game where you can be creative, strategic or just stand on a ammobox launching rockets.

It's tons of fun, it's balanced with ONE exception.
Cogwheel, get your ♥♥♥♥ together because you're still gunning me down without issues when we're two against you.

Again, LOADS of fun!

reviewText:
This game. Just playing it for a few hours, and I'm HOOKED!

Characters are an interesting bunch, each of them with their own abilities and special buildings. Also, some voice lines are really funny. Sure, some characters take time to learn, but the game is always about team effort and composition.

The stages are enjoyable, comprising of small ones with 1 cube to big ones with 3. A lot of them also have good spots for hiding e.g. respawn pads in enemy territory

When it comes to matches, they always differ from one another; for example, I could end up with a bad team in one match, losing really badly, and suddenly have a skillful one in another, winning with a big margin.

I'd say, this is one of the most unique FPS games I've seen. And since it also became free-to-play, there really is no restriction on playerbase. Friendly hint: go through the tutorials before playing to get familiar with the mechanics

reviewText:
Love this game, incorperates a suprisingly detailed and strategic foundation for such a simple looking game, the atmosphere is light and not too serious yet it caters towards thinking not mindless point and clicking. Different characters, different abilities, all having their own unique playstyle,movement animations,weight, size.  dialogue. which is something i find very refreshing when playing with some good friends with good team coordination.

Teamwork, or atleast communication is absolutely essential for having an effective outcome and it encourages players to tailor their strengths to compensate the weaknesses of their teammates and vise versa. metas are starting to form and deform as this game gains new players everyday and its a thrill to observe.

I highly recommend this game for anyone who likes to put their reflexes to the test aswell as their creativity.

reviewText:
It's another tile-based competetive multiplayer.

But there's the thing: it's not just another.

It actually requires strategy and tactical movements and building instead of your aiming with a graphical gun.

It is a very teamwork-based game which is great, it has revived the tile-based competetive multiplayer from failures like Guncraft and Castleminer Z.

The only problem is if you have one noob/newb on your team or just someone who doesn't want to cooperate you will most likely fail.

I recommend to any person who likes strategy/tactical competetive multiplayer and is willing to cooperate with their team.

reviewText:
This game is FPS. If you are good at other FPS's, you are still nothing in this game.

[h] What is this about? [/h]

It is about 5vs5 game where you usually want to destroy enemy core cube. There is 3 characters in free rotation, but total of 12 in total to play with in the moment I post this.
You can buy characters with either in-game money, which you get from playing game and once-a-day resetting small achivements, such as kill 3 brawn-class heroes or build 3 dynamite blocks. There is also this better money which you can buy with real money, which can be used also for purchasing heroes. Each class also has skins which you can buy with it, but real money makes you no better player than other.

Each class is different, and by different I mean by A LOT different. Sniper can only fight seriously from range, ninja brutally murders anyone in melee range and engineer keeps itself alive with turrets. So this game has 12 heroes whose all have this much difference. But each class have blocks, the building is important for all classes. For engineer it is the whole life, but ninja needs ninja nests which he can teleport into with his ability and sniper again can build tiki towers which can work as personal defense, or for greater good, for defending the core. Build, Build, Build.

The video in startup of the game tells much. You have to watch it to understand many things in first place, but there is perfect line picked from there:

If you can't get there
date: go over it. If you can't get over
recommended: get under it. "\n\nThis game is about strategy. You have to plan how to defend
hoursPlayed: or you will lose. You will know how to counter a defense to win in first place. You need to know how classes work in order to do anything useful with them or even counter them. Killing only slows enemy team
voteText: but never stops them from acting.\n\nTo this all
helpfulPercent: you need to know how to shoot. It is important
votesHelpful: but it only is only partion of total image.\n\nIn it's finest this game is a strategy game. I would say it to be mix of Minecraft

votesFunny:
[h]You need to know these to be good[/h]
* how to defend
* how to counter as many different defenses as possible
* teamwork. TEAMWORK.
* knowledge of all special blocks
* know how to use class
* know all the classes by look and voice

it it important

reviewText: I was a beta tester for Block N Load, so I've been playing it since the very beggining, and to be honest, there was nothing wrong with the pay-to-play version. It feels like Jagex realy took down the game's quality in an attempt to make this game more widely available. I mean, we used to have all heros and the only problem I can think of is a semi-long que time, not to mention the fact that most people had to pay $30 for this, and are only compensated with a $10 premium package. But with the addition of having to buy heros, perks, and other things, it seems that this once great game is going to freemium purgitory. However, the game is very innovative and fun, especialy if you're a fan of minecraft or TF2. overall, I would give this game a 7.8/10 for the new updates. Please Jagex, if your reading this, make some sort of change for everyone who is very dissapointed, who bought the game and are now disgraced by the fact that they have to share a que with unskilled free-to-play players who only make the game that much more frustrating. I would recomend something like a server for premium members, or even better, a remake of the origional.
