reviewText: This game has a ton of content. Nine characters, somewhere in the range of 15-20 maps, and each character also has a selection of different building blocks/traps/explosives/etc. they can pick from. Each match feels different due to the variety of approaches you can take such as tunneling underneath, planting a respawn pad behind your enemies base and having your entire team flank them, or just blowing everything up with a rocket launcher. The only downside is the small community, which makes it hard to learn or find tutorials on advanced techniques such as the best cutting locations for each map (where you cut the bottom blocks of a large structure to make it fall down and earn bonus blocks for your team).

reviewText:
How play Block N Load

1.) Buy Obi Juan" Shinobi
2.)Place special block near the enemy core
3.)Go to enemy core
4.) Block youself in and start hitting the cube
5.)Stay until enemy team find you after 5 mins and their cube is almost dead
6.)Use special and teleport back to special block
7.)Replace special block
8.)Repeat from step 3

11/15 yogstars would play again"

reviewText: I’ll bet you’re thinking “UGH! Another Minecraft clone?” which is what I first thought. At first glance, this game seems to lack any originality. It has voxel-based (cube) graphics, building and breaking, and guns. Be that as it may, I promise, if you play even ONE online game; you will experience the depth of the game. This game is in reality, a team oriented, hero-based, base-building, FPS. Your team of five is tasked with destroying the other team’s base, while at the same time, keeping them from destroying yours. With excellent balancing, a perfect blend of action and strategy, and a great leveling system, 9/10!

reviewText:
I've put more than a little time into this game, and I have to say, the developers listen to the fans. The community routinely bounces ideas off of them, and they very often implement their suggestions. If someone's OP, they fix it.

Additionally, each character has a serious amount of depth to them. Personally it's taken me dozens of games to get competent with a single character, and even then you still learn something new every game. Would definitely reccomend in its current state as a fast tactical shooter best enjoyed with friends.

8.5/10

reviewText:
This is an absoulutely amazing game and I have locked around 107 hours on this - a must play. It was implemented a while ago that the game was free to play and after that is exploded. Essentially it is a online block based stratergy shooter game, It is a very broad game with about 14 hero`s to play as with different skins and abilities - so one hero will be right for you. You play in multiplayer and there is a chat and voice chat to communicate with fellow teammates and you can also play with steam friends. Overall you defend your base and attack the other team - sounds simple but hours of fun to be had. This is one of the best games ive found in steam that is free to play and several youtuber have played it - boosting its popularity. However theese things may avert you from the game for some people:
-Purchases- You can buy things in game to get new heroes, skins and abilities.
-Cube style graphics- If you dont like this style and flow of a game it may be a deterrant for you.
-Trollers- Really this is anyones nightmare, in this game there are ways to break other peoples hard made defenses and even kill then which is very annoying, however you can report them and the Block N Load team are very supportive and helpful if there is any issues.

Things I like:
-Smooth gameplay- You dont need a high spec computer to play this, a regualr laptop will do fine.
-Child freindly- No graphic voilence, blood or rude language, completely clean.
-Variety- You can play as loads or hero`s and have different upgrades to add you own personal spin and skins to make characters look new. Also lots of maps to play.
-Creators, welcome!- they have recently released a new editor map feature to allow people to customise their own maps and unleash them to the steam workshop for other to enjoy.
-Play with friends- You can play with freinds you have on steam and freinds you have on the game itself. Also you can make a private game so only you and your freinds can join.
-High quality sound effects and graphics- They sound quality is supoerb even on myu laptop speakers and the graphics are near the top for this new cube style.

Overall this is an amazing game and everyone should try it. 10/10 from me.

reviewText:
I personally loved this game, though there is so much it needs to work on.

Pros:
-Interesting gameplay
-Really focuses on teamwork
-Interesting characters
-Not pay 2 win

Cons:
-Matchmaking is crap, you are a lvl one sarge against a expert team of yetis and juans ( Plus tony and the occasional pro sniper or doc )
-You earn way too little gold per match for 3,000 gold heroes  ( i am talking 75 or 50 per match )
-Some classes dominate, others suck.


Otherwise, it is a amazing game with solid gameplay and some hilarious traps and walls.

voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
PROS

No pay to win mechanics only paid skins
Nice selection of characters and three play styles
Unique game play not like other shooters you can build and shoot
Match making is quick, balanced and it's easy to get into a match
Max of 3 people in a party so no 5 premade stomps if you go solo
Simple game to learn but a hard game to master at high ranks
Runs on low and high spec PC's
Game devs communicate often and updates are frequent including balancing
Map editor and custom games

CONS

Low level and early play can be very frustrating until 10-15 hour mark
Community is strong but needs more players (it's not dying though 1500+ a day)
Better choice of paid skins most of the skins aren't very exciting

So I'm re-writing my review now this is Free To Play, I was a paid player however the game was dying due to lack of players, I'm glad it's free because there's now over 1500 active players daily on Steam and the game is in a much better state! Firstly unlike a lot of free games here's no pay to win which will please lots of people everything is unlockable over time apart from the skins and cosmetics which you need real cash for. Paid players who bought the game before it was free get character unlocks and skins as a reward for buying the original. Block n Load in my opinion is in the top ten best free to play games on the Internet or Steam. It's primary a shooter but has some Minecraft building mechanics and 5v5 game play like a moba which I'll explain below.

This game is simple but great though you need to get through your first 20-25 matches before you start getting team mates who know how to play and want to improve and learn the meta. Early on people clearly have no idea how to play, they troll a lot and argue and make stupid decisions which lose matches quickly. Low level players think they are playing team deathmatch game and generally do stupid ♥♥♥♥ so expect 10 hours of frustration before the game comes into it's own.

Once you hit match 25+ or above half of those lowbies carry on playing and get better and the others leave. Things get very fun once the competitive players remain and only the core community who understand the game are left.

Matches in general can last between 10-30 minutes and some occasionally an hour when teams are very well matched on the bigger maps. I love jumping on with a friend or two and found teaching new friends to play was nice and easy as there's a tutorial video and you can make custom games. What I enjoy most about Block N Load is some games are a long tactical slog where as others are rush rush rush and lots of killing and carnage with a quick win or defeat. One match you might be dug in on a stale mate and others you push early and gain the upper hand for a quick victory.

Block N Load certainly feels like a moba mixed with shooter mechanics and Minecraft block placement. It's matches feature 5v5 gameplay, choice of loadouts, cool skins and there is a kind of meta for each champ some are attacking and others defending play styles. There isn't any minions or skill trees like you'd get in a moba but your base is effectively the nexus or objective.

As you can see from the pics and vids it uses Minecraft like voxel graphics and engine which suits it nicely. It runs very well and is stable I never experience disconnection from their servers or get lag at all I've played ona 4mb connection and my home 70mb fibre. The combat is first person shooter like where you shoot other players with a small selection of weapons and fit out your character with perks and building objects but the moba element is basically two teams attack and defend each others cubes (Nexus) trying to destroy it to win.

Think DOTA/LOL but without minions, no buffs and there's no number based combat or pointing and clicking.

Just a side note I have never ever seen a hacker on this game either!

So basically to explain a match or the core game play a you get a build phase/resource gather phase which is normally 5 minutes to prepare your cube defence. After that a shield wall goes down and you battle until one team loses all their cubes (some maps have more than one).

There's not much else to say it's build then fight and then either win or lose. Games can be pretty intense and action happening all the time. My only complaint is the game should force at least one player to play an engineer or defensive class as sometimes you can lose a match in character select and build phase if no one on your team can build decent walls, traps or turrets.

The game can be won or lost in hero selection and in build phase if a player disconnects or leaves they are replaced very quickly, this is a great feature.

Block n Load is the best voxel based builder and shooter game out there!

reviewText: This game was fantastic in beta and even more fantastic now. Its a great game to play with your friends. If you want to have fun and just mess around and build i dont recommend this game for you but if you want to get competitive and work as a team to win this is a perfect game to you. Some people think of Minecraft the first time they see it, why you wonder? Probably beacuse you use blocks and you build with them. Minecraft and Block n Load are like two different worlds. Minecraft go creative do whatever you want. In Block n Load you can be very creative but in a different way. Maybe in minecraft you build a really nice castle you and your pigs can live in while in Block n Load you build a strategic base with maybe cool traps and defences. Before you buy Block n Load you probably wanna find somone to play with. It can get a bit repetitive at some times but there are many different maps and actully alot of events with maps and new playable characters in a limited time. Dont judge from if i do a thums down or thumbs up. I recommend the game to people who like strategic, creative" and wants a game to play with your friends :)."

reviewText:
Fun if you play with a few friends. Not sure the $30 price will ever be justified based on what I've seen. Even $20 is steep imo. Gifted by a friend, can't say I would've bought it.

Now onto the game. Don't let the animation fool you, this game's not just for kids. There are tons of different strategies you can use and the different classes make for a relatively fresh experience everytime you play. Especially when you have 5 people who have half a clue what to do, it can be very fun. But....

- needs a TON of balance work
- you can just play as Sarge and spam rockets to win
- the tank class isnt even a tank (a mortar cant blow up a sandbag?)
- the ninja can spam endless throwing stars
- you can't leave a match
- achievements are bugged
- you can't votekick or replace a player, so an afk usually means a loss
- no voice chat, super important for a game like this
- too many viable cheap, trolling options for easy, boring victories
- map design in general needs work, and more maps added

I understand the game isn't fully released yet, and hopefully the game has an active dev team that is aware of most of this. I could certainly sink some hours into this game.

I'd say keep an eye on it, and look for updates/reviews. Personally I wouldn't pay $20-30 for it right now.

reviewText: This game is a very fun, challenging and entertaining game. I think one of the most important things to remember about this game is that it is in beta, sure there are glitches and problems, but thats why you are playing a game in beta, thats why it isnt released. All these people giving it negitive reviews, complaining about queue times, you have to remember that the game isnt released, its not the devs fault if there arent a lot of people playing. At the end of the day, i really enjoy this game, its true every game is different. It totally reshapes your thought process, it is something that we havent seen executed well, and i think it has a lot of potential. If you are having doubts, try it while it is in beta. you will be pleasently surprised.

reviewText: block n load, a game that IF you played the original which was ace of spades you would probably have 2 opinions of this game :opinion A: your extremely glad to see that the idea of a sand box first person shooter isnt dead and you really want to buy this game :opinion B: your not sure wether or not you should buy this game after the train wreck which was ace of spades. now first of all i want to say this game does a sand box first person shooter REALLY well, to a point where i would call this the first sandbox shooter game in history (that i know of), it has 6 characters to choose from and they are all amazing in their own way's, and speaking of ways this game did things right i personally love the art style of this game, now at first this game seems like it takes alot of its art style from tf2 and i see where that comes from, but in my eyes it reminds me of toy story in the way it looks and feels which is a HUGE throw back that i welcome with open arms, the only problem this game has is that its abit TO team based, so if some A hole disconnects or if there is some guy running round not helping his team then I JUST LOST THE MATCH!, but aside from that the game is flawless in every way compared to the original ace of spades, im soo glad to see that what ace of spades was trying to accomplish didnt die in vain and now block n load is here to make what ace of spades failed to do into a dream come true.

reviewText:
83 hours played in last week. I do recommend this game to all the people who are thinking if to buy it or not.
The best is to play with friends or people from forums, who are up to speak on teamspeak or other talking program for the best results !
This game requires teamwork and each 6 characters (1 will come out soon, 2 in the future) should communicate with each other and support with its tool, special abilities and other ways, so you should choose 5 people team carefully ! For each map you should choose different tactics if to dig under and blow up the base - or try to infiltrate and create spawning points at the back of the enemy base and rush the cube !
Really nice gameplay, easy to play, requires the strategy and coordination together with other team mates. I give 9/10
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Saw this trending on steam over weekend and tried it out, had tons of fun and bought it after free play period ended.

While its only one game mode (several maps) the amount of things you can try on defense and offense has kept the game from getting stale for me so far.

Classes all feel pretty good, engineer specifically feels like a defense only class due to short range of shotgun and repair secondary but i guess thats to be expected somewhat.

Pretty high time to kill which is a nice change of pace compared to most modern shooters.  Shooting and movement interaction is somewhat unique, you can move across map and up ledges very rapidly though you move very slowly while actively shooting, seems to simultaneously make positioning very important for the shooter while allowing enough fast movement for others to close into better range quickly, and also allowing for rapid escapes.  Its somewhat unique but i think the system works well here.

Even if not a shooter player at all, the building portion of game is just as important, and you could just focus on mining / setting traps and not fire a gun all match and still be pretty helpful to your team.

reviewText:
Graphics are polished just enough that the game still appears current.

Game Balance - Fairly balanced as of this writing but there are a few heroes that could use a boost to their blocks or abilities to put them inline with others.

Singleplayer - A custom game or training mode allows you to get use to the maps, heroes, base-building mechanics along with the provided tutorials and videos. You can lock down a custom mode game with a friend(s) and train or strategize your gameplay for Casual or Ranked modes.

Multiplayer - Lots of fun with a decent group of people (or at least a group that's forgiving/helpful and not jumping down your throat). Games start pretty quickly in the Casual mode but the new Ranked mode takes up to 30 minutes to get a game together. Hopefully that is resolved with more people playing this game. Built-in voice chat that works fairly well too.

Maps - Quite a few maps to choose from and battle on. A good variation with all sorts of stategies for each and more maps being added fairly frequently.

Heroes - Fun to play and a playstyle for anyone. More heroes being added and they've been very well balanced. There's no set team and most times you can play what you want with hurting the team too much. Communication is key; type or speak call outs and strategy in-game.

Overall - I love this game. Great game, very addicting gameplay. So much fun to strategize building your defensive (and offensive) blocks then go after their cubes (bases). If you're looking for a comparison, as most posts claim, Minecraft combined with Team Fortress 2. I bought the skin pack purely to help the developers out and get more people playing this game. I suppose the skins are kinda cool too. =P

If you pick up the game, feel free to add me if you're looking for a buddy to group with. Always down for some BnL with good people.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A minecraft and TF2 knockoff, but probably one of the best knockoffs I've played in a long time.

The game blends building and destruction from Minecraft with the modern weapons, graphical style, and gunplay of TF2.  Add on some strategy for the icing on the cake, and you've got Block n' Load.

The game stays true to the No game's the same" line
date: as every time the teams are different
recommended: and thusly the strategies change from map to map and team to team.  One time
hoursPlayed: I played against a five-player team made entirely of Cogwheels.  Other times
voteText: the teams can be perfectly balanced and equally matched to the point of one destroying the other's cube as they watch their own cube blowing up.  We BOTH lost!\n\nThe controls and climbing can and probably will feel clunky to dedicated FPS players
helpfulPercent: as they're a bit odd.  Optimization COULD use some work
votesHelpful: but it was made with Unity
votesTotal: which is not brilliant for optimization.\n\nAll in all
votesFunny:
I would recommend for anyone who wants something a little different in the FPS department.
Tony and Nigel FTW!

(Sidenote: This is my first Jagex game
commentsCount: I cannot really give a yay or nay about them since I haven't been around for them ruining Ace of Spades and other stuff I hear them getting ragged on about.)"

reviewText:
Hi all,

I really like this game, I played a little on free weekend and then bought it. I have about 20 hours at this time and it's great fun. I love how i'm always learning new things with almost every game, there are so many ways to do things that you can always find a way to turn the tide of battle (well, not always but if you play smart you will be rewarded!)

I've been in several games where we were about to lose and someone made a brilliant move and we ended up winning by pushing forward as soon as we got the momentum. I've also been on the losing end of those moves haha. We are about to win and all of a sudden we are scrambling because we messed up something or other team made a couple good plays.

I highly recommend this game and at under 20 bucks, it's well worth it.

I've been in several games where we were about to lose and someone made a brilliant move and we ended up winning by pushing forward as soon as we got the momentum. I've also been on the losing end of those moves haha. We are about to win and all of a sudden we are scrambling because we messed up something or other team made a couple good plays.

I highly recommend this game and at under 20 bucks, it's well worth it.

reviewText:
83 hours played in last week. I do recommend this game to all the people who are thinking if to buy it or not.
The best is to play with friends or people from forums, who are up to speak on teamspeak or other talking program for the best results !
This game requires teamwork and each 6 characters (1 will come out soon, 2 in the future) should communicate with each other and support with its tool, special abilities and other ways, so you should choose 5 people team carefully ! For each map you should choose different tactics if to dig under and blow up the base - or try to infiltrate and create spawning points at the back of the enemy base and rush the cube !
Really nice gameplay, easy to play, requires the strategy and coordination together with other team mates. I give 9/10

reviewText:
Teamwork.
Intense matches.
Cool characters, blocks and abilities.
Explosions.

Every match I learn something, no matter if it's a win or loss.
A simple new build strategy.
How to better support my team.
Tendencies of enemy players.

Defense is extremely rewarding.
It feels like every choice I make matters.
Here's a fun story from a single match.
-----------------------------------------------------

An enemy attacker jumps into the base triggering multiple traps that drain his health as I throw gas grenades from above to finish him off. :D
I jump down and re-trap the base a bit and then move back to my high ground position.

The same enemy finds the staircase I built early in the match to reach the top of the building.
He runs up it and is instantly killed by the mines I've hidden in blind spots. :D
I repair the damage done to the staircase and re-trap the blind spots.

The same enemy comes back.
Not wanting to use my stair case again, he scales the building from a different position by carving his own path.
But upon reaching the top is so intent on chasing and shooting at me he doesnt notice the mines I've embeded into the floor for protection.
He steps directly on them, bringing his health down low enough to where I kill him with one shot. :D
He's done some damage to me so I heal up at my hidden health block.
Then I repair the floor but don't have enough block points to re-trap the mine field. :|
So I move out of position to do a bit of resource farming and then come back, but I place only a few mines so I can conserve block points.

The same enemy comes back a bit smarter and builds a radar, just before reaching my position, that reveals the traps near me.
Feeling confident he charges in, hitting me with lots of bullets, avoiding the few traps I have in place.
I hit him with a couple shots, but I know I can't win a straight gun fight against him.
So I jump down a level and run to a stack of boxes for cover.
The enemy chases, spraying bullets.
Quickly I build 3 mines on the back side of the boxes, drop a couple gas grenades at my feet, and then back away, positioning myself next to another hidden healing block I placed sometime ealier in the game.
Because he chased me away from my defending position, we are no longer in range of his radar, so he can't see the trap I've just improvised.
The enemy comes around the boxes, guns blazing.
He wants to kill me bad!
The gas grenades go off dealing him minor continuous damage.
Then he trips the mines and they explode his face off. :D

5 seconds later the attackers on my team deal the final blow on the enemy base.
Victory! :D

During all of that I had to manage killing other enemies that were doing damage to our base, supporting team mates by building health and ammo blocks in changing key positions, repairing block structures, leveling ground, blocking and traping enemy tunnels, etc.

-------------------------------------------------------

A very cool game.
Smart play pays off.
Team work makes the dream work.
♥♥♥♥ing awesome.

Try it!

reviewText:
Bunch of fun to play with friends when you're bored.

My opinions:

- Funny, unique playable characters that each have different abilities and attitudes
- Every game is never the same and will always be fun
- Creative traps and abilities
- Intense gameplay (At most times)

However,

- Needs way more players (Every game needs 10 players queued)
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Graphics are polished just enough that the game still appears current.

Game Balance - Fairly balanced as of this writing but there are a few heroes that could use a boost to their blocks or abilities to put them inline with others.

Singleplayer - A custom game or training mode allows you to get use to the maps, heroes, base-building mechanics along with the provided tutorials and videos. You can lock down a custom mode game with a friend(s) and train or strategize your gameplay for Casual or Ranked modes.

Multiplayer - Lots of fun with a decent group of people (or at least a group that's forgiving/helpful and not jumping down your throat). Games start pretty quickly in the Casual mode but the new Ranked mode takes up to 30 minutes to get a game together. Hopefully that is resolved with more people playing this game. Built-in voice chat that works fairly well too.

Maps - Quite a few maps to choose from and battle on. A good variation with all sorts of stategies for each and more maps being added fairly frequently.

Heroes - Fun to play and a playstyle for anyone. More heroes being added and they've been very well balanced. There's no set team and most times you can play what you want with hurting the team too much. Communication is key; type or speak call outs and strategy in-game.

Overall - I love this game. Great game, very addicting gameplay. So much fun to strategize building your defensive (and offensive) blocks then go after their cubes (bases). If you're looking for a comparison, as most posts claim, Minecraft combined with Team Fortress 2. I bought the skin pack purely to help the developers out and get more people playing this game. I suppose the skins are kinda cool too. =P

If you pick up the game, feel free to add me if you're looking for a buddy to group with. Always down for some BnL with good people.
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A minecraft and TF2 knockoff, but probably one of the best knockoffs I've played in a long time.

The game blends building and destruction from Minecraft with the modern weapons, graphical style, and gunplay of TF2.  Add on some strategy for the icing on the cake, and you've got Block n' Load.

The game stays true to the No game's the same" line
date: as every time the teams are different
recommended: and thusly the strategies change from map to map and team to team.  One time
hoursPlayed: I played against a five-player team made entirely of Cogwheels.  Other times
voteText: the teams can be perfectly balanced and equally matched to the point of one destroying the other's cube as they watch their own cube blowing up.  We BOTH lost!\n\nThe controls and climbing can and probably will feel clunky to dedicated FPS players
helpfulPercent: as they're a bit odd.  Optimization COULD use some work
votesHelpful: but it was made with Unity
votesTotal: which is not brilliant for optimization.\n\nAll in all
votesFunny:
I would recommend for anyone who wants something a little different in the FPS department.
Tony and Nigel FTW!

(Sidenote: This is my first Jagex game
commentsCount: I cannot really give a yay or nay about them since I haven't been around for them ruining Ace of Spades and other stuff I hear them getting ragged on about.)"

reviewText:
my search is FINALLY over!

i have been looking for a multiplayer game that i haven't gotten bored of and that i could find fun for a while. i saw yesturday that block n load went free to play. i didn't buy it because i never found any matches in the beta and i wasn't sure if i'd enjoy it but now that its free to play i thought i'd try it. turns out its fun.

matches can be a pain to find but at the time i'm writing this review it takes me up to 3 minutes to find a match but usually it doesn't take that long. the reason it takes so long is when you find a match you have to click the accept button and some people don't know how to do that by the looks of it.

who ever says it takes a long time to find a match OR that block n load is pay to win is full of ♥♥♥♥. it doesn't take long to find a match and the ONLY thing you have to pay for is skins EVERYTHING else can be earned by playing the game.

also people who own a tropico game might get a skin of el presidente from the game for block n load. i tried the beta but the skin i know i have looks too much like el presidente from tropico to be a beta reward so i think you have to own tropico to get it. by you have to own tropico to get the skin i mean 3 or 4 (those are the only tropico games i own) but it may be for all the games OR theres a VERY small chance it could be for playing the beta so if anyone finds out which it is let me know!

reviewText:
Okay, i am a huge tf2 fan and play minecraft when i am bored..
But you didn't ask this, no you didn't, but that's what's the wiki says: '' ..takes a bit from Minecraft, a little of Team Fortress and mashes it together..''.
But the trailer of the game says ''no games the same''.

So, which is right? Well i say NO game is EVER the same. TF2 is a gem and games that say they are like tf2 are just saying they a multiplayer objective based FPS with a cartoony style. TF2 is so much more than this, you could give a thousand more tags.

This is not minecraft ethier, minecraft has a very strong indie style and is very customisable, this game just uses the block mechanic and there are a thousand games that do also.

So what makes Block N Load not like any other game, it's because of its way if posing the matches, the way you have a build time and you need to defend and attack .

But what some people may criticise but i think is what makes the game awesome is gold system and the way you buy heros and level up and get perks, if these systems weren't in place i would have played 1 round and went, this is because i play to level up and get enough gold to get the next hero or a new perk it's great and keeps you coming back for more because when you unlock a new hero it's not like you got a new skin or new rank you now have a WHOLE NEW playstyle to play around with.

I love this game and unlike most new multiplayer FPS’s there's always a match running for you to jump right into. Download for FREE now and make sure you block and load.

Have fun!!

reviewText:
83 hours played in last week. I do recommend this game to all the people who are thinking if to buy it or not.
The best is to play with friends or people from forums, who are up to speak on teamspeak or other talking program for the best results !
This game requires teamwork and each 6 characters (1 will come out soon, 2 in the future) should communicate with each other and support with its tool, special abilities and other ways, so you should choose 5 people team carefully ! For each map you should choose different tactics if to dig under and blow up the base - or try to infiltrate and create spawning points at the back of the enemy base and rush the cube !
Really nice gameplay, easy to play, requires the strategy and coordination together with other team mates. I give 9/10
voteText: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Saw this trending on steam over weekend and tried it out, had tons of fun and bought it after free play period ended.

While its only one game mode (several maps) the amount of things you can try on defense and offense has kept the game from getting stale for me so far.

Classes all feel pretty good, engineer specifically feels like a defense only class due to short range of shotgun and repair secondary but i guess thats to be expected somewhat.

Pretty high time to kill which is a nice change of pace compared to most modern shooters.  Shooting and movement interaction is somewhat unique, you can move across map and up ledges very rapidly though you move very slowly while actively shooting, seems to simultaneously make positioning very important for the shooter while allowing enough fast movement for others to close into better range quickly, and also allowing for rapid escapes.  Its somewhat unique but i think the system works well here.

Even if not a shooter player at all, the building portion of game is just as important, and you could just focus on mining / setting traps and not fire a gun all match and still be pretty helpful to your team.

reviewText:
Hi all,

I really like this game, I played a little on free weekend and then bought it. I have about 20 hours at this time and it's great fun. I love how i'm always learning new things with almost every game, there are so many ways to do things that you can always find a way to turn the tide of battle (well, not always but if you play smart you will be rewarded!)

I've been in several games where we were about to lose and someone made a brilliant move and we ended up winning by pushing forward as soon as we got the momentum. I've also been on the losing end of those moves haha. We are about to win and all of a sudden we are scrambling because we messed up something or other team made a couple good plays.

I highly recommend this game and at under 20 bucks, it's well worth it.

reviewText: I bought the game when you had to pay for it and I played it with a friend we had fun thought the game was amazing it was something different that once you knew what you were doing you had a wonderful time. Then soon after, the free to play update came out. I did not care much for the update but what got me was the poor amount of compensationt hey gave for people. Instead of letting us still get all current and future heroes they give us a skin pack and tell us we now need to purchase future heroes. A skin pack does not compensate the amount spent to pay for it. What makes things worse is this attracted the FTP crowd of children that make communities so much worse. These kids jump on anything they can find that looks good and is free to play and just make the community ♥♥♥♥. For example now instead of balanced teams which were easy to coordinate with reasonable people everyone wants to be the sniper and God help you if you try to tell them otherwise. Kids like snipers kids want to be mlg so they pick the kit they think will make them mlg. These kids focus on setting up their little bases to camp and snipe from mostly leaving the core exposed. 90% of games I have played the only person building defenses was me. I would also like to add the complete lack of looking for the objective as all these kids do is go off on their own and try to get as many kills as possible. It almost feels like there is no objective at all other than shoot the enemy snipers. The only way to counter this stupid strategy is to dig under the map and crawl your way to the cores which they NEVER try to defend. This game used to be fun with mutual defensive builds and tactics to get in but now its just dig under the snipers and win this game quickly turned from fun action to how much longer am I going to dig my way through this game. I am extremely disappointed the way the developers screwed over everyone that supported the game when they paid for it and let the community fall to the FTP kids that kill all FTP communities. If you want to play this game anyway after reading the review I recommend planetside 2, first person shooter in which people actually DEFEND THE BASES AND PUSH AT APPROPRIATE TIMES. the kits are also free so save the grind.

reviewText:
I'll start by saying the mechanics are very good. The digging and building both work very well, and the shooting is fun. I don't think the shooting is anything revolutionary, but it's not bad by any means. The classes feel relatively balanced.

Adding minecraft mechanics to a shooter doesn't actually add too much. It's an interesting concept, but there really isn't much it adds in terms of strategy (and it adds very little to shooting). There needs to be so much more done to really be tactical and deep.

This game does all those things needed. While the game may only look like a shooter with minecraft mechanics, it uses those mechanics and many others to create a game all about tactics, resource management, and most of all deception.

That's a very nice summary, but explaining why the game is about those things can't be done in a paragraph. The objective in this game is to defend your team's cube while destroying the enemy cube. There are so many strategies that both sides can use.

Maybe you'll charge in and try to hit their cube with your shovel, maybe they'll have mines waiting for you. Maybe they'll dig under your base and try to disarm your traps, maybe you'll see them on your radar (which you have to set up, and can be destroyed) and dig down to them and throw some grenades in their tunnel. Maybe you'll try and sneak behind their enemy lines and set up a spawner so you can attack from a better angle, maybe they'll use radar to find and destroy it. Maybe they'll put down radars on your base to try and find your radars, and destroy yours, or you'll see them and stop them. Maybe you'll have a teammate set up some mortars and try to get close to call in a mortar strike on their defenses, maybe they'll send in a teammate to find and destroy the mortars. Maybe you'll build a bridge in the sky above their defenses, put a bomb down, and then destroy the block under it so it falls, maybe they'll dig out whatever's supporting your skybridge before that happens (blocks can't just float like in minecraft, they'll basically ragdoll if they're not attached to the ground at least through some other blocks touching it). Maybe they'll dig under your base and place bombs to completely devastate your defenses, maybe you'll disarm them, or maybe you'll turn the huge pits around your cubes into an even more effective defensive structure.

There are so many ways to attack and defend in this game, and they give you so many tools to be creative.

Maybe you'll build a bridge in the sky above their defenses, put a bomb down, and then destroy the block under it so it falls, maybe they'll dig out whatever's supporting your skybridge before that happens (blocks can't just float like in minecraft, they'll basically ragdoll if they're not attached to the ground at least through some other blocks touching it). Maybe they'll dig under your base and place bombs to completely devastate your defenses, maybe you'll disarm them, or maybe you'll turn the huge pits around your cubes into an even more effective defensive structure.

There are so many ways to attack and defend in this game, and they give you so many tools to be creative.

reviewText:
I have played this game throughout its time in Beta, and therefore have formed a few rudimentary opinions. TL/DR: Buy it if you're a casual gamer, but if you hate the thought of losing through things which aren't necessarily your fault, this isn't for you.
Firstly, there are many positive attributes to this game. These are: a good blend between building and combat, with what ultimately feels like two substantial halves, some good map diversity, and an enjoyable experience that can either end in 5 minutes of mayhem, or 30 minute long sieges with ridiculous defense lines. Both of these present their own challenges, and ultimately enjoyable experiences.
However, the game falls down in both its players and design elements. Firstly, I have found the community to be less than helpful, with toxic players often weighing down games. Beyond this, a lack of rating results in you often being saddled with players far below the average level. Characters suffer from being unbalanced, and the game itself has issues with queue times and a limited pool of players.
I think this game has potential to evolve into something great, and would personally say buy it, but given Jagex's record, dont expect them to listen to community advice anytime soon. Either way, if you're willing to cope with a sometimes toxic environment and losses you feel cheated on, this game is worth it's modest £10 price.

reviewText:
As I first saw this game I admired the complexity and
depth this game offered for a beta.

So i decided to stick with it leveled all my charecters to max, dragged 2 of my buddies
into this game and was very excited as i saw the ed of the beta phase incoming.

Then as the beta ended and the new characters got released I was a little bit
worried that the new characters would destroy the carefully constructed gameplay system
and unballance the whole gameplay.

and they did


Astrella destroyed to fast to many blocks, and her doublejump was pretty op

Sweet Sience´s health regen destroyed any need for the ninja

and Dream Genie was surpriesingly balanced and a great addition to the gameplay


but jaggex turned the car in the right direction and nerfed it all out


Then nothing happend and I invested litterly 300 houres in total and spent a great time
with my friends and i found myselfe thinking in class about posslible new characters,
talked with my friends about the great sessions we had

(fun-fact: my character ideas were an electric themed Alien with a taser, a yetti with a snow minnigun and a
chinese dude with a bow and arrow whom were groomed with fireworks)

And THEN a new character bundel (over which I crunched again) was on the way with
an anouncement

BnL is going to be free 2 play and i was shocked

At first I tried to think positively about the free 2 play model,
then I read the update thingyemaho where all the updates are written down

and i abandoned the game.

Because what i read was:

-All mylevels will be gone
-The game will be flooded by noobs
-I cannot play with my friends anymore (!!!)
-there are gonna be micro transacions
-I will have to buy all the new heros
-ALL MY LEVELS ARE GONNA BE GONE ALL OF THE 300+ HOURES AND THE TIME I WAS JUST THINKING ABOUT IT

But don`t you worry core community
date:
the developers said You will get a "special" skin which does nothing"

What I think they should have given:

-A special Titel for playing their game until now
-All heros + the new ones/make the new heros cheaper for them
-A skin of choice for your favourite character +all the old skins
-ALL THE NEW SKILLS (only on level 1 though)

What that would have caused would have been a new spark for old and new players
and not an annoyence for old players to clear out the feld for the new ones

With this action they disrespected the core community that stuck with them during their hardest time
of BnL and showed that they dont give a bull about us new or old players

And i know that they were short on money and so they moved to the more lucrativ Free 2 play model
but by showing that they dont think that they NEED us anymore in the new game by reseting ALL the
progress made makes me feel disgussed

So thanks for nothing Jaggex I played your game so much that I nearly predicted 2 of the 10

reviewText: I really do like this game, however unless you have a full squad with your friends or something you are pretty much garuanteed to have 12 year olds on your team that have no clue what they are doing. If you are a competitive person like myself, you will have a hard time enjoying this game. Also there are many people that just spam the chat since there are no restrictions. Once again if you are competitive like me - I hate to lose lol - then you might have a hard time enjoying this. I do really like the game, and think that when it grows and gets more people above the age of 12 then I will enjoy it more, however at the moment it is either AFK's, people that have no idea that there is even another team, and spammers. I recommend it because I see the potential that it has and can't wait for a little bit better community.

reviewText: Didn't think much of this game when I first saw it on the store, but my sister ended up trying it for a Runescape promotion, and got me to try it, and quite honestly, it's a really interesting game, only have a few hours in at most right now, but I think it's something totally different from any other game out there right now.\n\nMain idea going into it, is that it's a combat game, like a cross between Halo, and the load outs from CoD games, in a Minecraft-esq world, that is nearly entirely destructible :)

reviewText:
to start this game gives off a kind of MOBA feel kind of like what Super Monday Night Combat" was supposed to be while still staying with the "Ace of Spades" feel
i cant quite put my finger on what makes it feel inferior to ace of spades though maybe the classes arent as thought out as they seem
maybe the damage dealing aspect is too small compared to the types of Heros youre up against
maybe its that headshots dont quite hurt as much as youd think

all in all its hard to hate something youre good at and its easy to pick up and understand that forts and traps are the name of the game in this game rather than "Zurg Rushing" the enemy base since before combat starts they give you 6 minutes to build and fortify your side of the map"

reviewText: A fun game that combines building and fps with voxel graphics. You can build almost everywhere on the map. There are several different characters with different talents. Sometimes matches can go on for quite a while but I like that! However, in terms of play style you’ll pretty much be either heading straight into battle or sneaking around trying to do heartland attacks. So, is it worth the price? Yes, most certainly so!

reviewText:
I loved this game in the beta stages, and I still play it now time to time.
But making it free to play ruined pretty much everything.

It can be very fun to play (if you have a semi competent team.)
But over half the time you'll have a team that chooses three heavy characters etc and loses.

When I used to play, I was level 36 and was excited to level up, but the F2P update took away all my levels and character upgrades and replaced it with owning the original characters and a few skins.
I payed TWENTY DOLLARS for the game and I feel like I should get something more than characters that should be free already. Plus, people who payed for the game don't get any new characters, (Yuri, Kira Chan, Kreepy, etc.)

Gold and Platinum are the stupidest things ever... That's all I have to say about them.

THE SERVERS ARE HORRIBLE, I GET CONSTANT LAG SPIKES AND HIGH PING.

Don't even get me started on character balance...

Those are just a few of the reasons that I feel ruined the game.
This is all my opinion so don't flip out.

TL;DR: the devs ruined the game and unless they fix it, I'm not changing my review.

reviewText:
A very fun and interesting game.

This game combines Loadout with Minecraft. To get this!

This game is made purely for the enjoyment factor. You build, destory, defend, and attack. Each character has their own special loadout to take with them. Plus the tutorial is very simplistic and easy to understand.

If this game does support gamepad (Which i think it does, i could be wrong) i highly recommend getting a gamepad controller it will make using the controls a lot more eaiser.

I recommend it.

reviewText: A fun FPS with a twist.  Choose one of serveral characters, outfit them with different placeable blocks/weapons/etc., and start the match.  You have about five minutes to build defenses on your side of the map, and then the separating wall comes down and you defend your cubes and bases, while trying to destroy those of the enemy team.  Build up turrets and radar and walls for defense, charge straight for the enemy, or be a sneak and try to dig under enemy lines and place spawn points, bombs, and more on their side of the map.  Nearly every block in the game is destructible, so you have a lot of freedom.  Definitely worth trying.

reviewText: I've gotta admit, Jagex really stepped up their game after the release of this beta. I remember when I used to play Ace of Spades, before Jagex bought the rights to it. I loved that damn game! I was REALLY bummed out that the creator, Ben Akoroy or something like that, decided to sell it to the ♥♥♥♥♥iest company that he could think of. How could you put so much time and work in to the game, only for it to be wasted and absorbed in to the trash heap, and then use the same game, only now it's covered in dog crap? I can confess, I was not thinking of the amount of things that Jagex ♥♥♥♥ed up, RuneScape, and now AoS. Even if you liked the new AoS, who the hell were you gonna play with? Servers on that game were empty, and now it's even MORE empty! I bet I can't even find ONE damn server that doesn't have the game mode Classic" or "Zombies"
recommended: that's how much ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t I put up with Jagex. Fortunately

reviewText:
Terrible player base, mostly 12 year olds in a HEAVILY team oriented game.
Clunky mechanics but, honestly, balanced surprisingly.

Amazingly fun, and will probably only get better.

There is something to be said about the adrenalin that is had when fortifying before an enemies attack,

That said, the first five minutes are the most fun of each match.


PLEASE MAKE GIANT ARENA FFA OR 2v2v2v2


Final thought, Do you like building?
Do you like watching your buildings burn?
Play this game.
voteText: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful

reviewText: The game is pretty good over all, Like people have been saying there are problems such as the FPS being really bad or how theres alot of AFK's and theres no punishment, But since this game is in beta i would give it a chance. Many others have said the gameplay is slow but its all on how you play it with your team. You can either be defensive which will make the game slow or be agressive which will speed up alot. On top of that people have said the price is not worth the game, but later on there should be a different offer to purchase from since as of right now the package you can buy is the  Block n Load: Fully Loaded Editions" which comes with not only the game itself but AOS and skins.\n\nMy overall raiting for this game is a 7/10
date: if they can fix minor problems with the game in my opinion it should be a great game\n\nAnd yes the game is made by Jagex which from my knowledge is a horrible company but i think this game is going to be a prety good one."

Terrible player base, mostly 12 year olds in a HEAVILY team oriented game.
Clunky mechanics but, honestly, balanced surprisingly.

Amazingly fun, and will probably only get better.

There is something to be said about the adrenalin that is had when fortifying before an enemies attack,

That said, the first five minutes are the most fun of each match.


PLEASE MAKE GIANT ARENA FFA OR 2v2v2v2


Final thought, Do you like building?
Do you like watching your buildings burn?
Play this game.
voteText: 8 of 15 people (53%) found this review helpful

reviewText: The game is pretty good over all, Like people have been saying there are problems such as the FPS being really bad or how theres alot of AFK's and theres no punishment, But since this game is in beta i would give it a chance. Many others have said the gameplay is slow but its all on how you play it with your team. You can either be defensive which will make the game slow or be agressive which will speed up alot. On top of that people have said the price is not worth the game, but later on there should be a different offer to purchase from since as of right now the package you can buy is the  Block n Load: Fully Loaded Editions" which comes with not only the game itself but AOS and skins.\n\nMy overall raiting for this game is a 7/10
date: if they can fix minor problems with the game in my opinion it should be a great game\n\nAnd yes the game is made by Jagex which from my knowledge is a horrible company but i think this game is going to be a prety good one."

reviewText: It's a great beta game, could use a lot more optimization. But again, it's in beta so you have to expect it to be under optimized and unbalanced. I usually play as Nigel, the Sniper and I find that his primary weapon (Nellie) is very underpowered. I also feel that the Ninja (O.P. Juan Shinobi) is way too overpowered as it two hit kills (and sometimes one hit KOs) most of the time and is very mobile. So far from what I've observed, the community isn't too nice or educated about the game. Alot of people attack their teammates as they do not know that there is Friendly Fire" and they destroy their own bases and do not know the actual objective of the game. I feel that the game is poorly optimized (in terms of smoothness and FPS rate) but of course
date: it is a beta. One thing I hope that does not happen is a pay to play or pay to win game
recommended: in which you need to buy the game (although I may buy it - if the game is updated and new content is added that makes me want to constantly play the game) or pay for microtransactions to gain an overpowered ability in the game.\n\nAll in all
hoursPlayed:
it's a good game but it still needs a lot of updating. I definitely recommend checking it out. Sign up for a beta key on their website - it's free! https://www.blocknload.com/

PS: Will update later.
"

reviewerDisplayName: Fox the Dark Demon Cookie Wolf
reviewText:
From my experience in playing this game, it may have been just 1 hour, but it was the worst hour of my life.

Let's start this off with the servers. The servers are horrid. I had a 23 ping on the server (on average[US server]) and everyone else was lagging around like their getting their internet off of a dead raccoon.

The Balance: There basically is none. Leveling up grants you more power basically. So a new player will have no chance of beating a higher level player.  As you level up, you gain access to more abilities such as lower active cooldowns, more uses on your active ability, and so on. And not to mention that you have to be level 6 to get access to change what blocks you can use. That might not sound bad, but here's the thing, those blocks have more heal, plus there's an actual bomb that you can use to destroy blocks. You'd figure that everyone would have acccess to it, right? Nope, you have to be level 6 to get it.

But wait, there's more. One would think that if you're new, you'd go against other new players, right? Wrong, you get thrown in with higher levels, so have fun trying to play a game where everyone who's played longer has abilities to destroy you instantly.

The heroes": They're okay at best
date: but the only way you can do anything to kill enemy heroes is pay to get better ones.\n\nOn the topic of paying: The game has a P2W (Pay to win) system. You can pay for new
recommended: powerful heroes that will just destroy everyone else and there's nothing you can do about it. The IGC (In Game Currency) you get is literally nothing after any match making it so you have to literally grind the hell out of the game to even afford someone new to play. Yes there is a free rotation
hoursPlayed: but you still have to buy someone to play as no matter what (unless you wanna live off the rotation for the rest of your life).\n\nLast words: The game it's self is an "ok" game
voteText: it's just that all the bull ♥♥♥♥ that they just packed in makes it literally unenjoyable to play. The leveling system breaks it
helpfulPercent: the pay-for-perks system breaks it more
votesHelpful: and the heroes that just destroy everyone else just puts the final nail in the coffin.\n\nA game may only be as good as the player
votesTotal: but when the game has too many broken aspects
votesFunny: the game is the bad one
commentsCount: not the player."

reviewerDisplayName: Fox the Dark Demon Cookie Wolf
reviewText:
From my experience in playing this game, it may have been just 1 hour, but it was the worst hour of my life.

Let's start this off with the servers. The servers are horrid. I had a 23 ping on the server (on average[US server]) and everyone else was lagging around like their getting their internet off of a dead raccoon.

The Balance: There basically is none. Leveling up grants you more power basically. So a new player will have no chance of beating a higher level player.  As you level up, you gain access to more abilities such as lower active cooldowns, more uses on your active ability, and so on. And not to mention that you have to be level 6 to get access to change what blocks you can use. That might not sound bad, but here's the thing, those blocks have more heal, plus there's an actual bomb that you can use to destroy blocks. You'd figure that everyone would have acccess to it, right? Nope, you have to be level 6 to get it.

But wait, there's more. One would think that if you're new, you'd go against other new players, right? Wrong, you get thrown in with higher levels, so have fun trying to play a game where everyone who's played longer has abilities to destroy you instantly.

The heroes": They're okay at best
date: but the only way you can do anything to kill enemy heroes is pay to get better ones.\n\nOn the topic of paying: The game has a P2W (Pay to win) system. You can pay for new
recommended: powerful heroes that will just destroy everyone else and there's nothing you can do about it. The IGC (In Game Currency) you get is literally nothing after any match making it so you have to literally grind the hell out of the game to even afford someone new to play. Yes there is a free rotation
hoursPlayed: but you still have to buy someone to play as no matter what (unless you wanna live off the rotation for the rest of your life).\n\nLast words: The game it's self is an "ok" game
voteText: it's just that all the bull ♥♥♥♥ that they just packed in makes it literally unenjoyable to play. The leveling system breaks it
helpfulPercent: the pay-for-perks system breaks it more
votesHelpful: and the heroes that just destroy everyone else just puts the final nail in the coffin.\n\nA game may only be as good as the player
votesTotal: but when the game has too many broken aspects
votesFunny: the game is the bad one
commentsCount: not the player."

reviewText:
WALL OF TEXT
***********************************************************************************************************
Installed it... my eyes started to get tired after a while... So I decide to take a break. Long and behold 7 hours of gaming had past! This game is cocaine on steroids! But... but... but.... but there is a tiny problem gameplay turns stale after a while.

You realize you can divide the map into two and force players into awkward entry points that your team has the upper hand.

For example: There is a map divided by a bridge-like wooden structure with tons of wooden crates. As soon as the game starts I would go to the part near the trees and make a 2 blocks with hole straight to the water. This makes it harder for tunnelers to simply dig a hole from their base into ours. Next I make a huge hole on top to make sure who ever is above ground has a hard time getting passed and if he does he would have to 1- build his own way into our base or 2- be funneled into our base.

So that's it that's how you win that map.

Next there is a map with some sort of tower thingy idk hard to describe and another that has both bases separated by 2 bridges.... Both use similar tactics, make a huge hole all the way to the lave (bottom of the map) and defend the cube from above.

See where I'm going with this? Once you figure out the best strategy that's pretty much GG.

Another map you can dig straight through your base and you find yourself on mid air so you build a bridge that will lead straight to the enemy's base... GG.
***********************************************************************************************************

TL;DR = Great game but get's stale fast once you figure out the winning strategy but I still think it's a good game.

reviewText:
I had the opportunity to play this game at RuneFest, a convention for RuneScape which is one of Jagex's most-known achievements in its game history, before it was even mentioned to the public. Right then I knew it would be a fun and casual game and not something that requires too much time.

The concept is brilliant and the amount of teamwork needed makes it a great game to play with friends. Alternatively, this also leaves you prone to being teamed up with people who could care less and just do their own thing. Luckily, I haven't experienced the latter and have actually seen a good amount of willingness to teach and help players that are newer to the beta.

The only concern I have is that Jagex is going to be charging a price for this game according to the description. If this is the case, this game will fail, just as the several games that Jagex has tried to make before it. There is no way I would pay more than $5 to play this game the way it is. It's too simple and too casual to invest more than that. If you want to gain $$$ then add skins (like you are doing) and possible even characters but try to stay away from pay-to-win mechanics (which unfortunately you are also known for in RuneScape, your most successful game).

tl;dr Not worth paying more than $5 for, a fun and casual game, has potential, hopefully Jagex gets it right this time.

reviewText:
6/10 In Beta

I enjoy this game very much. I find building the defenses very relaxing at most times, and the offense very intense at times. A couple things do need worked out though.

1. Spamming/Griefing
I do not come across spammers or griefers too often but when I do it's very annoying. I feel there should be an anti-spam system and possibly a vote to kick for griefers.
2. O.P. Juan Shinobi is very overpowered as he is VERY agile and can 2 hit sometimes 1 hit enemies.
3. The sniper, Nigel, is underpowered with his primary weapon.
4. Not very many maps. The map selection is very slim and they get old after a while.

Other than those things the game is good. I just hope that the game does not become pay to win and those problems are fixed. :)

To quote another reviewer about defending.
you always have something to do and are not just sitting there in a corner with your level 3 sentery waiting for someone to come and take the intel."
I just love this reference."

2. O.P. Juan Shinobi is very overpowered as he is VERY agile and can 2 hit sometimes 1 hit enemies.
3. The sniper, Nigel, is underpowered with his primary weapon.
4. Not very many maps. The map selection is very slim and they get old after a while.

Other than those things the game is good. I just hope that the game does not become pay to win and those problems are fixed. :)

To quote another reviewer about defending.
you always have something to do and are not just sitting there in a corner with your level 3 sentery waiting for someone to come and take the intel."
I just love this reference."

reviewText:
I had the opportunity to play this game at RuneFest, a convention for RuneScape which is one of Jagex's most-known achievements in its game history, before it was even mentioned to the public. Right then I knew it would be a fun and casual game and not something that requires too much time.

The concept is brilliant and the amount of teamwork needed makes it a great game to play with friends. Alternatively, this also leaves you prone to being teamed up with people who could care less and just do their own thing. Luckily, I haven't experienced the latter and have actually seen a good amount of willingness to teach and help players that are newer to the beta.

The only concern I have is that Jagex is going to be charging a price for this game according to the description. If this is the case, this game will fail, just as the several games that Jagex has tried to make before it. There is no way I would pay more than $5 to play this game the way it is. It's too simple and too casual to invest more than that. If you want to gain $$$ then add skins (like you are doing) and possible even characters but try to stay away from pay-to-win mechanics (which unfortunately you are also known for in RuneScape, your most successful game).

tl;dr Not worth paying more than $5 for, a fun and casual game, has potential, hopefully Jagex gets it right this time.

reviewText: This game was great. Was. The new update has turned it in to every single grinding free to play at the top of the steam free to play list. Everybody who played the game prior to the recent update and had any form of character levelling has been reset, you must now pay either in game money, or of course, real money to purchase back your favourite characters, mine personally being the great Tony Turretto, but of course, grinding a game endlessly to make your account stronger with characters, perks and platinum bars is obviously more fun that just simply hopping in to an match with a few friends for a couple of hours and enjoying the game, i do however not have a problem with the game going free to play as more players has always been necessary to this game and of course the more people that play this once amazing and unique game the better, but i find the fact that the freedom of just playing with any character i wanted and the game being balanced so that a new player was on the same statistic level as an experienced player was great, fun and enjoyment was right in front of you as soon as you hit that 'Go' button, but now, a unique game of instant fun and even playstyle has been ruined, and i feel deprived of a great game, which recently, great games have been hard to find. If you love mind numbing grinding for endless hours with little reward other than 'Why don't you pay £6.99 for a booster pack!?' then this game is perfect for you, but if you enjoy hopping in for an hour and having a few fun matches, then sorry but you missed the time for that version of Block N Load.

reviewText:
I've been a major supporter of Jagex for about 10 years now, and when I heard about this game, I figured I'd give it a shot while it was free to try for 3 days after release.
I was worried it may have ended up a Minecraft ripoff, but I was pleasantly surprised.
Block N Load takes 2 ideas that have already been done (Minecraft and Team Fortress 2) but mixes them in a beautiful symphony of game design, creating its own original style that I've never seen done before, with replayability beyond my initial expectations.
It truly is a different experience every game, primarily in part due to the near unlimited potential to destroy and build.
Unlike Minecraft, you won't be able to build in bliss, you're always under pressure. In the preparation phase, you only have so long, and need to hurry. In the actual battle, you won't even have that luxury, you'll be building walls, placing bombs, and even establishing a forward base as bullets fly overhead and artillery is tearing apart the world around you, and you'll never know whether or not someone might sneak up on you while you're building and knock your block off (pun intended).
As soon as the game's free to play time was up, I immediately purchased it and haven't looked back.
The only major problem with the game I've encountered is the fact that my account is level 90 (currently the level cap) and can still get paired with four level 0s, which means certain defeat for your team no matter how good you are. This could be easily fixed by only pairing people of similar skill levels, though the exact method would be up to Jagex.
Unlike what many others have said, I have to disagree with the opinions on the overall community. Though there are plenty people who take me back to my Modern Warfare days, it's pretty tolerable, and not TOO common for me to make any major complaints. It could use some improvement, but so long as you're not too thin-skinned, you should be fine for the most part.

I'd highly recommend this game to most everyone, and will continue to play, myself.

reviewText:
I only tried this because of Runescape.
Still have to get my cosmetic outfit in runescape. (yes i played 5 matches)

First of all, the game hasn't enough appeal.
Itlooks like it's made for children and once ingame i actually think it was made for a lower age.

The gameplay has nice twists BUT i love sneaking and tunneling but it sucks that it takes so damn long
because once you get to their core it's mostly game over for you.

So basicly the game is a bit too fast when you want to sneak and too slow when you just run and gun since it can take a long time to finish a round.

The graphics aren't top notch but look alright.
Controls feel a bit clunky at times specially when moving faster with the ninja.
Animations could be done a lot better imo.

i'd recommend this game for the time being but i don't think it'll last very long.

Other than that, it's xp waste while you play runescape >.>

reviewText: A friend recommended this game to me so u bought it. No regrets. It is better than 2% of all games iv'e ever played. Its basically league of legends but not as good. Jagex should stick to Runescape. Ace of Spades is a far more superior game to this so just buy that instead. Ace of Spades is a first person shooter in minecraft. So its basiacally a cheap copy of minecraft that has guns yet is the worst fps ever released. Back to Block and Load. Let me tell you some of the pros and cons of Block and Load. Its cons are that its a bad game taht should bever be played because of how bad it is, its failure to actually teach you how to play the game, and its terrible gameplay. Its pros are the lackluster graphics, sub-par shooting mechanics, and the audio which was probabally taken off of a free online call of duty soundboard. At the end of the day this is a terrible game that you should only buy as an April Fools Day joke for your friends.
